characters: THE DEAD BODY OF PO SUNG
A THIRTY SECOND CLINIC IN HAVING YOUR BUTT KICKED FOLLOWS
A FIFTY MILLION DOLLAR CORPORATE CHECK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ret Where THE CAMERA FINDS two pairs of feet kicking fiercely from below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where TWO YOUNG CHINESE BROTHERS (PO AND HAN) fight for their lives atop a jagged skyline of breaking whitecaps. CREDITS BEGIN TO ROLL... The sea has never seemed more violent, dancing and choking them from swell to swell. The makeshift raft keeping them afloat nothing but a tattered basketball. Yet they doggedly cling together, a shared dream and their love for each other conspiring to keep them alive. Welcome to the eight-hour escape from Mainland China to the promise of a new life in Hong Kong.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHTER
dialogues.text: As Younger Brother (HAN) starts slipping away, losing his tender grasp on the raft and survival. Older brother (PO) sees this and makes a desperate lunge to help... For a sickening moment Han is swallowed whole by the dark water. Then Po ABRUPTLY HOISTS HIM BACK UP. As Older Brother hugs him protectively to the meat of the raft...

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG HAN
dialogues.text: (CHINESE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are the great lights?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG PO
dialogues.text: (CHINESE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not far. Hong Kong will shine bright as day, even at night. A HELICOPTER SHOT drags us away from them.... PULLING BACK TO REVEAL the hours of naked sea truly ahead... and then WE MATCH cut TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where THE SAME HELICOPTER SHOT sweeps in hard and low over the water, now a lifetime away from our opening vision... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A BRIDGE looms across the water ahead... then A_DARK SUV atop the bridge... AS WE COME IN TIGHT WE SEE...

dialogues.speaker: FOUR ASIAN BAD-ASSES
dialogues.text: Riding inside. The sheer mass of each man's muscle threatening to shred the fabric of his Hugo Boss suit. The CREDITS CONCLUDE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where WE FOLLOW the same SUV making its way through the descending darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where THE HYPNOTIC BEAT OF EASTERN-FLAVORED TRIP-HOP courses through the cabin. WE WATCH the same four men as they start feeding their machines. -- Are withdrawn. We're looking at the Fortune 500 of firearms -- S&W .40's, Sig-Sauer .380's, even a pair of MP-5's for safe measure... : FRESH CLIPS -- Are THUMBED for empties and JAMMED into the grips... LEAD ROUNDS -- Are RACKED into waiting chambers... ING P’ -- Are fitted for protection in case shit turns loud. The cherry on top. Just because you may have to put someone down doesn't mean you have to go deaf doing it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thriving gambling and dancing joint set amongst the Oakland docks. Think of it as a little taste of Vegas nestled inside the jaws of Hip-Hop. The Cops are paid not to ask and the Brothers happy not to tell. The SUV KNIFES into the loading zone, quickly joined by a Porsche. Then STEADICAM FOLLOWS as HEAVY BLACK SHOES exit and make an even march for the club...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where PO SUNG (MID 30'S) drains off his third vodka rocks. Looks very much the Asian-American playboy -- hair fucked up, Zegna suit and tie, tea shades complementing a bone-handled cane. (CONTINUFD)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Two ASIAN HOTTIES DANCE SEDUCTIVELY before him. This is serious business for his female companions -- working themselves into a startlingly salacious coupling. Po smiles lazily as the girl's tongues touch in a brief flicker. Rotates the bone handle of his cane back to reveal a small coke stash. Casually dips a nail and does a bump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As WE REALIZE they're the only Asians in the place. A ROOMFUL OF BLACK GAMBLERS AND OTHER DANCERS dagger them with stares as THE SECURITY STAFF approaches. The lead Bad-Ass wastes no time stepping up to the Chinese...

dialogues.speaker: BAD-ASS
dialogues.text: Leave a twenty for the drinks and crawl the fuck outta here. The MUSIC DIES OFF, leaving a searing tension in its wake. Po stares back with an almost infuriating indifference.

dialogues.speaker: PO
dialogues.text: It's all good, Bra, no worries. I'm simply waiting to talk to a friend...

dialogues.speaker: BAD-ASS
dialogues.text: You don't have any friends in this motherfucker. That's the problem. Patrons TALKING SMACK fuel this from the safety of the crowd ("Bye-bye you Chinese motherfucker" etc.). After a beat...

dialogues.speaker: PO
dialogues.text: I'm no psychologist, but you seem like a pretty angry guy.

dialogues.speaker: BAD-ASS
dialogues.text: You don't know the haif of it. The table is JERKED OUT to extract Po when...

dialogues.speaker: A CADRE OF CHINESE
dialogues.text: aside. Pound for pound these guys are every bit as hard- core as their counterparts. And you thought it was tense before... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sung Family enforcer, KAI (LATE 20'S), walks the point. This guy would have Van Damme crapping his pants inside a minute -- his face reflects that. Sunglasses are canted to reveal hard eyes and the bad attitude to go with ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: KAL
dialogues.text: Let it go, Po. This is a hassle we don't need. Po shrugs. Another lazy smile. But the Bad-Ass sticks a hand into his chest keeping him from sliding out. Po SWIFTLY STRIKES, -- the cane just a vague blur as it CHOPS the hand down, CRACKS ribs on both sides, then BUTTS the guy flush on the temple with the bone handle. Kai shoots hima “What the fuck's wrong with you" look as the man drops...

dialogues.speaker: KAI
dialogues.text: (to his men) Get him outside. A second bad-ass confronts the enforcer as Po is hustled out...

dialogues.speaker: BAD-ASS
dialogues.text: Take his place, you'll take his ass-whipping as well.

dialogues.speaker: KAI
dialogues.text: (lowers his sunglasses) Bring whatever you've got. The young black takes him up on it -- but Kai SNAP-KICKS the guy's knee so quickly that his foot is back on the ground by the time WE HEAR the ACL SNAP,... The enforcer BOXES HIS EARS on the way down with a DEAFENING CLAP. Kai calmly breast-pockets his shades. Then in the blink of an eye it's on...

dialogues.speaker: FULL VIEW
dialogues.text: As A BRUTAL MELEE ERUPTS across the casino. We're treated to a perfect blending of Martial Arts and Street, EXTREME HAND-TO-HAND STUFF showcasing the better elements of both... One of the blacks CLOTHESLINES a Chinese throat... Two others TRADE OPEN SHOTS Hagler/Hearns-style until one simply drops... Kai leads the pack, racking ass at a furious pace. He TOSSES one guy through A GLASS PARTITION, then puts the wood to SEVERAL BROTHERS emerging from the crowd to lend a hand... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: But one bad apple spoils the fun. A Chinese is the first to go for his piece. Now a really nice moment as A DAISY CHAIN OF HANDGUNS ARE DRAWN SIMULTANEOUSLY, dropping into place like a row of dominos... Black gun jammed to Chinese temple -- an Asian .45 stuck in black's belly -- Mr. 45's spine scissored by a pair of -380's, and so on... A long beat. Both sides teetering on the brink of annihilation. Then THE SOUND OF A SHOTGUN BEING RACKED rolls over the house P.A...

dialogues.speaker: SILK
dialogues.text: tands next to e@_ microphon din weapon. He's the owner and sole proprietor of this casino, and his AK- 47 TOTING BODYGUARDS now cover the room.

dialogues.speaker: SILK
dialogues.text: Guns don't kill people -- people kill people. He steps from the open DJ booth and starts down the stairs... SILK (cont'd) Now if you'll excuse me, gentlemen, you're disrupting my business. Slowly, the weapons are lowered. SILK (cont'd) So if your ass isn't black, you best drag it out my establishment. Bad-Ass #2 hobbles upright to confront Kai.

dialogues.speaker: BAD-ASS
dialogues.text: (cold, lethal) This shit is far from over.

dialogues.speaker: KAI
dialogues.text: Fine -- we'll do it again once you start walking. The Chinese gather themselves for the exits...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Kai has Po pinned up against his Lexus...

dialogues.speaker: KAI
dialogues.text: You wanna explain this to me? Huh? We're in the middle of a (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: KAI (cont'd) war What the hell were you doing in there?

dialogues.speaker: PO
dialogues.text: (blowing it off) I decided to stop in for a few drinks, liven up the party. Whatever. I'ma big boy now...

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: (directly) You don't belong here -- or anywhere like here -- ever. (shakes him) Those fucks will bury you first chance they get... sharply slaps his comrade's hands away and shoves him ack...

dialogues.speaker: PO
dialogues.text: You work for me, Kai...

dialogues.speaker: KAI
dialogues.text: For your father...

dialogues.speaker: PO
dialogues.text: One and the same. You don't give orders -- you take them.

dialogues.speaker: KAI
dialogues.text: Get your mind right, Po. As long as there's a war going on you're my responsibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Po throws his cane into the backseat of his black-on- black Austin-Martin. Climbs in and ABRUPTLY GUNS past an arriving car to vanish into the night. The arriving driver gets out to watch the others disperse. This is our first glimpse of COLIN O'DAY (BLACK, EARLY 20'S). A late young man wondering what it is he's just missed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where an African-American PAPERBOY bikes down a placid street, -half-asleep as he delivers the morning edition. WE WATCH HIM nail a run of doorsteps with uncanny accuracy. Then something makes him hammer the brakes. WE FOLLOW his eyes upward as the little face flashes with horror... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THE DEAD BODY OF PO SUNG
dialogues.text: Hangs lynched from a streetlight. The corpse has taken a ghastly beating, face distorted almost past the point of recognition. Off the paperboy's HAIR-RAISING SCREAM we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Syndicate Overlord CH'U SUNG (60'S) channel-surfs the MORNING SHOWS while chain-smoking his beloved Marlboro Reds. He looks to be a jocular man, outwardly sweetened by his advanced age and success, occasionally LAUGHING at the t.v... His EVEN OLDER MAID finally drags away the lavish breakfast tray he's ignored...

dialogues.speaker: MAID
dialogues.text: (scolding in CHINESE) Those filthy things are no kind of breakfast. Not good for you. You must eat something.

dialogues.speaker: CH'U
dialogues.text: (perfect English) Life's not good for you, you old hen. It has a horrible prognosis and always ends in death. She leaves in a pout, A THROATY CHUCKLE escaping his lips. Within seconds DOORS BANG OPEN in the house...

dialogues.speaker: MAID
dialogues.text: (calling out) INT. CH'U SUNG'S MANSION - MORNING tll WE GET OUR FIRST GOOD LOOK at his palatial estate as Ch'u hurries into the hall... If you were expecting dragon statues, gilding and red carpets you're out of luck -- this ain't no Szechwan take out joint. Everything is decidedly Californian, making the point that Sung is glad to have come to America and shared in her riches...

dialogues.speaker: THE FOYER
dialogues.text: Where Kai enters, members of his cadre pouring in around lesbuls GG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 12 13 CONTINUED: “ay WE DON'T HEAR THE WORDS he whispers in the old man's ears. But something seems to die ete Ch'u then, face withering with unthinkable anger.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHTER
dialogues.text: Slowly turning away. He stares out the window oe unseeing eyes. The ee of his swimming pool rippling gently in the breeze. THE CAMERA SLOWLY TRACKS INTO the pool until it FILLS THE SCREEN and then WE MATCH CUT TO...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Another swimming pool, perfectly mirroring the first. As WE BEGIN TO TRACK BACK OUT a lone golf ball SPLASHES the surface. A beat. A second ball follows...

dialogues.speaker: FAVORING
dialogues.text: As he SHANKS yet a third shot froma chipping green. The self-made crime lord HEAVES his five-iron into the landscaping and cinches the sash of his Armani pajamas...

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: Fuck Tiger. I hate this game. Then WE HEAR A PHONE RINGING inside the house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the phone waits on the counter. Isaak puts it to his ear, idly opening the refrigerator door...

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: (talking into phone) What do you have to tell me? He slips a half-gallon of milk from the ice box, dribbling some onto his chest as he takes a hit straight out the carton. t's a small thing, but very revealing -- the street manners of the man abruptly peaking through to the surface... ISAAK (cont'd) (suddenly attentive) Sung's boy? Is that so? Who did it? (half beat) Damned straight you better put it together. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Isaak CLICKS OFF, face now clouded with concern. After a beat...

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: This might mess things up. EXT. HONG KONG - AERIAL SHOT - ESTABLISHING i4 As WE GLIDE OVER the TEEMING METROPOLIS.. Her bright face of glass and steel confidently poised on the brink of the New Millennium...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ancient stockade in the bowels of the city. This place is so fierce it makes Quentin seem like Musso & Frank's. WE FOLLOW a police van as it passes through the gates. SEVERAL ARMED GUARDS watching from above as MANACLED NEW PRISONERS are directed inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where SILENT INMATES pass along the meal line. A dollop of rancid stew is their only reward. The Head Guard KICKS one man's tray loose and forces him to the ground. SAVAGELY CANES HIM.

dialogues.speaker: HEAD GUARD
dialogues.text: (MANDARIN)

dialogues.speaker: PRISONER HAN SUNG
dialogues.text: Watches this from the eating benches. We're immediately struck by his dignified carriage, unbowed by captivity. Face as self-~possessed and patient as the young McQueen. ONE OF THE NEW PRISONERS approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: NEW PRISONER
dialogues.text: (MANDARIN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are Han Sung? Han gives him a piercing once-over before nodding. The New Prisoner takes a seat beside him. NEW PRISONER (cont'd) (MANDARIN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have word of your family. The bad news is relayed quietly. Han's devastation is that of Ch'u squared. He tries to speak, but finds his throat mute... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WHAACK! The rattan cane BITES INTO Han's cheek without warning. The Head Guard now smirking over him...

dialogues.speaker: HEAD GUARD
dialogues.text: (MANDARIN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay quiet, Officer Sung. Your stupid words ruin a golden silence. Han matches his glare. Thinks. Then HAMMERS his tray of steaming crap into the bastard's face. Cheekbones CRACK, nose EXPLODES. The cane is snatched up and WHIPLASHED IN A BLUR across the man's head and chest... A RUSH OF GUARDS descend. He TAKES A FEW OUT before they DOG-PILE his ass to the ground... INT. HSING-KANG PRISON - CORRIDOR - DAY a Where Han -~- apparently unconscious -- is DRAGGED down a concrete tunnel by FOUR GUARDS IN RIOT GEAR. His eyes flicker just as WE ENTER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Amnesty International stickers here -- this is the place where prisoners go to die. The Riot Squad drags Han in, shellacking him with BATONS to the gut... Two guards prop him up as a long-chained shackle is clamped to his left ankle. The other cuff is to be thrown over the ceiling beam to hoist him for a good, long beating... Evidently Han has other plans. His leg ROCKETS from the six to twelve position to K.O. the man closest. He JERKS THE CHAIN FREE from Number Two then.whips it back out, COILING IT around the guy's neck... Two steps, THREE KICKS and a pair of busted face shields later Numbers Three and Four meet a similar demise. Then Han starts digging for keys...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where A GUARD stands post before the door. A KNOCK FROM INSIDE the beating room. The sentry turns and OPENS the in i 7 (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HAN'S HAND
dialogues.text: ROCKET iT and GRABS the m by the throat. He forces the guard to unlock him, then YANKS the guy's head into the iron door KNOCKING HIM UNCONSCIOUS. Han steps out dressed like a quard. Takes the fallen man's keys and speeds off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Han searches frantically for a way out. Finally he comes upon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where A FLEA-BITTEN JANITOR waits there for the Teller to cash his puny payroll check. Han passes through, those £f. a. sh. do’ ash leering back from the cage. Janitor catches Han staring. They share a look. Smile. The ALARM KLAXON ERUPTS SUDDENLY. The Teller grabs the * HOUSE PHONE to receive orders. Takes a baton and THUNDERS OUT for the main prison. A second shared look. Han's hand DARTS OUT to halt the cage door inches from closing. Two more smiles. Han passes an obese stack of currency through to the man -- then takes one for himself and makes for the exits... The janitor thinks. Scoops up his paycheck as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the gates are CLOSED AND LOCKED. MORE GUARDS arrive and race inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where WE SEE GUARDS double-time through, weapons in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Han is still looking for a way out.

dialogues.speaker: A LOCKED GATE
dialogues.text: Re sa he 2 he corri . With ALARMS SOUNDING AND LIGHTS FLASHING Han runs over. He tries one of the keys -- no luck. Same goes for a second. M ifu th a tu: it. Han steps through into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where HE DISCOVERS a ladder leading upward and begins to climb...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where TWO CREWS run out to a pair of helicopters preparing to lift off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Han climbs higher still up the shaft...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where A PACK OF GUARDS finds the unlocked gate. They pass through to the base of the elevator shaft...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 29 Where the HATCH OPENS and Han finds the two helicopters. The first TAKES TO THE AIR. Han runs to the second and jumps onto the skids as it LIFTS OFF as well... The guards SWARM OUT OF THE HATCH seconds behind as Han is flown to freedom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where two patrol boats are being launched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 390 31 Where the chopper carries Han out over the Harbor. He LOOKS DOWN... then abruptly lets go to DROP INTO THE WATER. The helicopter WINGS AROUND and circles over the splash point -- but there's no sign of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the patrol boats RACE BY. As they pass WE SEE 32 Han SURFACE and climb into the small compartment centering the buoy. As he closes the door WE CATCH SIGHT OF an airplane passing overhead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old-school nsighborhood fixture. Some fifty years of doing good business with no signs of letting up. WE WATCH the striped barber's pole spiraling proudly over the entrance. THREE BLACK BARBERS share gossip and shoot the breeze with BLACK CUSTOMERS inside.

dialogues.speaker: A FLOTILLA OF CHOPPED NISSANS
dialogues.text: Saunter the boulevard towards them. Tinted windows obscure the occupants and EASTERN-FLAVORED TRIP-HOP whispers seductively from inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where one of the barbers looks up to find the gayntlet of cars now fanned across the street, facing the shop.

dialogues.speaker: BARBER
dialogues.text: What in Hell... A_TORRENT OF MACHINE GUN FIRE broadsides the roon. The mobile hit-squad BEGINS LACERATING the men and the building without mercy. A Molotov is lit and thrown inside. Quickly SWEEPING THE SHOP UP IN FLAMES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where WE FOLLOW Isaak and MAC -- an ambitious young lieutenant climbing the O'Day corporate ladder -- across the terminal. SEVERAL BLACK ASSOCIATES of Isaak's on their heels. The entourage passes cleanly through the metal detector - except for Mac. Tense moment here as we wonder what he's packing. Then two pagers and a cellphone later he's allowed in.

dialogues.speaker: ONE OF THE GATES
dialogues.text: Where Ch'u and Kai await with SEVERAL OTHER CHINESE OVERLORDS. DECENT FAMILIES ON VACATION clutter the background as Isaak arrives.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: Nice touch with the metal detectors. Keeps everybody honest. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CH'U
dialogues.text: Trust is increasingly hard to come by these days. Isaak bristles at the inference. Their respective bodyguards settle into a heavyweight stare down.

dialogues.speaker: CH'U
dialogues.text: If you were looking for a line to eross, you found it.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: I had absolutely nothing to do with it.

dialogues.speaker: CH'U AND ISAAK
dialogues.text: Framed by planes TOUCHING DOWN OUTSIDE on the tarmac...

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: Stuff like this is senseless for everyone -- it doesn't pay. If it was someone on my side, I'd flay his ass and have it messengered over. I've got kids myself, you know,

dialogues.speaker: CH'U
dialogues.text: (cold, hard) My son is dead -- that's what I know.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: You have my condolences, of course...

dialogues.speaker: CH'U
dialogues.text: Of course...

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: ...But I'm done telling you it wasn't me. Believe it or don't, that's your business.

dialogues.speaker: CH'U
dialogues.text: We all believe what we want to believe, don't we Isaak? Truth rarely enters into the equation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Ch'u and his enforcer make for the exits. OTHER TONG MUSCLE steadily drops into line behind them from the crowd. Trust is increasingly hard to come by...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As OTHER BLACK BAD-ASSES step to Isaak and Mac in exactly the same fashion. Despite the many differerces, they appear kindred souls, the Oakland gangster and his Asian counterpart...

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: I've already called Maurice and told him to shadow Trish. Didn't want to take any chances.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: (approvingly) Brains like that will keep you high atop the payroll. You know how his people are, even if she is a civilian...

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. Those motherfuckers make everything personal -- whether they right or not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where we find the sparkling TRISH O'DAY (20's). Clothing from the '70's, stacks of old-school wax, her shop retails the whole retro trip. It's a hot-spot for neighborhood kids -- Black, White, Chinese, whatever. A cultural DMZ. A GROUP OF THEM peer inside the display case like cats at a caged bird.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Lori... Will you please give these little monsters their funk fix?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As co-worker LORI (20) comes out to the case. She unsleeves The Meters' rare and exceedingly funky Rejuvenation. "People Say" leaps on the platter. The smiling kids start grooving with childlike innocence. Lori and Trish BUST UP at the familiar sight.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Watch the store, huh? I have some errands to run.

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: No worries. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Trish takes her purse and tries to make her way out, but a few of the older kids take her hands and drag her into the dancing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Trish strides out to find MAURICE (20'S) AND A DRIVER waiting outside. Mo is one of Isaak's lower-level street thugs -- a Wanna-Be headed straight for Never-Was.

dialogues.speaker: MAURICE
dialogues.text: (checking the sign) Serpentine Fire. Smooth, huh? Kool and the Gang jam from back in the day...

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Earth, Wind and Fire.

dialogues.speaker: MAURICE
dialogues.text: Right, right... He tosses down a shaky Philip Bailey spin move. MAURICE (cont'd) ...the serious shit.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (£latly) What are you doin’ here?

dialogues.speaker: MAURICE
dialogues.text: Things is heatin' up. Mac sent me to escort you around.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (rolls her eyes) Thanks, but no thanks. Tell him I'll be just fine.

dialogues.speaker: MAURICE
dialogues.text: Blood is blood. Your dad won't want to hear that, and it'll be my ass if he does. (motions) Your choice, girl -- backseat, or the trunk. Your do-gooding don't mean shit to me. : Trish knows he means it. Reluctantly climbs in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Han exchanges Chinese currency for U.S. Dollars, a travel bag slung over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: where A TELEPHOTO SHOT frames A FLURRY OF PASSENGERS hustling out to ground transportation.

dialogues.speaker: THE FACE OF HAN
dialogues.text: Melts suddenly from the crowd, A MATRIX-STYLE SLOW-MOTION FIGURE centered in AN ENDLESS SWARM. A beat. He moves OUT OF FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Han pays THE CASHIER and loads various purchases into his travel bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Trish is absently thumbing through a pile of old records. Distracted by...

dialogues.speaker: MAURICE
dialogues.text: HEAD BOUNCING as he waits for her by sampling a CD at the New Release rack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Han follows an empty taxi pulling in. He approaches the PAKISTANI CAB DRIVER and holds out...

dialogues.speaker: A CRUMPLED LETTER
dialogues.text: hi ars a . He points out the handwritten American address...

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: Can you take me here? It's my brother's place.

dialogues.speaker: CAB DRIVER
dialogues.text: What's the story, pal? Can't read- a-da-English? He points to the dome light atop his hack. CAB DRIVER (cont'd) Two words -- off duty. And with that the cabbie gets out and heads for a store...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Han slides behind the wheel. Checks the visor for the keys first. No luck. Shrugs acceptantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Maurice grooves deeper into the music. Trish uses the opportunity to slip out unseen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out comes a_ screwdriver. He STABS IT into the ignition and PRIES. The ENGINE ROLLS OVER. A satisfied smile. He's just pulling out when Trish leaps into the backseat...

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Just drive. Long beat. Han points to the ceiling to parrot the driver...

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: Two words -- off duty.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (shoving a fifty through the slot) So now you're on duty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Maurice finally takes a look around and realizes Trish is gone. He darts for the door in a panic -- headphones JERKING HIM BACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Maurice CAN NOW BE SEEN moving into the parking lot to search for her. Trish quickly ducks down.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (earnestly) Will you please just get me out of here? Another acceptant shrug. WE HARD CUT TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: «Han BARRELING down the wrong side of the street. After a frantic game of chicken with on-coming cars he gets it and drops into the right-hand lane. Different country, different customs. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Trish peels herself off the rear windshield.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Where exactly you from.. (reading license) . -Ahkbar?

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: Hong Kong.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: You wanna start the meter? He studies the complex contraption mounted on the dash. Blindly pushes a button. Ooops. A roll ecei: SPILLS onto the floor until he can finally STOP IT.

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: Forgot. It’s broken. She studies him in the rearview for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: You steal a lot of cabs in Hong Kong?

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: Only when I can't find a bicycle. Do you want me to pull over?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (gauges him, shakes her head) That's alright. (after a beat) So is it true what they say oes Hong Kong?

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: That everyone there knows Kung Fu?

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: (amused) Of course. State law.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Even the women?

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: Especially the women. Trish checks to see if he's putting her on. LAUGHS WARMLY when she catches sight of his smile.
Where THE CAMERA FOLLOWS the cab crossing over a bridge into downtown.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Can you break a board with your head?

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: A cinder block?

dialogues.speaker: BAN
dialogues.text: Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: How 'beut a horse?

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: Easily.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: I'd have to see that, Ahkbar. You must be a very dangerous man. (looks out the window) This is good. You can drop me off at the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Han shakily maneuvers the taxi to the curb.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Thanks. Han pushes her fifty back through the slot...

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: Meter broken. Remember?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Keep it. I won't tell the cops.

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: I don't want your money. 52 53 54 (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (taking the bill) You seem like a nice guy. You should find a new profession -- stealing cars doesn't fit you.

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: {turning now) What was your name?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: You think I want you calling me?

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: I don't have a phone.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (killer smile) There's a dead giveaway... He watches her swing onto the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. PRIVATE GOLF COURSE
dialogues.text: Where Isaak and real-estate magnate IVAN ROTH (40's) walk the back nine. A cart follows carrying Mac and Roth's WHITE ATTORNEY. Roth lives wrapped in Teflon, a Big Money Boy hovering perpetually above the law. Would have hijacked a few S&L's back in the 80's if only he'd been old enough.

dialogues.speaker: ROTH
dialogues.text: How's the acquisition of my new property coming?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: Slowly. Some people just hate parting with their land. They've needed some... convincing. They stop at the next hole. Isaak plants his tee first.

dialogues.speaker: ROTH
dialogues.text: I make the presentation tomorrow. It's non-negotiable.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I've had a lot of free- thinkers to deal with. Isaak takes a Mo Vaughn-sized cut -- trying to overpower the ball with muscle alone. A huge divot is TORN FREE and the ball SLICES into the rough... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ROTH
dialogues.text: (warmly) Isaak, my new friend. You're murdering yourself. Golf isa game of finesse -- not power. In that sense, it's much like the rest of life. Roth comfortably slips into his stance... ROTH (cont'd) The key is helping the body work together demonstrates) Forearm straight, wrists locked, hands firmly on the grip. (pulls into backswing) That way the club is allowed to do ea work. Eyes never leaving the all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roth PERFECTLY DRIVES his bali down the fairway. Admiring it as it drops nicely on the green.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: (mutters) These graphite shafts don't do it for me.

dialogues.speaker: ROTH
dialogues.text: Save the excuses. Some heavy investors are leaning on me, big men that won't tolerate a wait. (deep freeze) It's a simple equation -- no land, no... Dave, what's the popular term these days?

dialogues.speaker: ATTORNEY
dialogues.text: (brightly) Cheddar. WE NOTICE Mac shoot this crazy white boy a look...

dialogues.speaker: ROTH
dialogues.text: That's right. No cheddar. AmI making myself clear? (off Isaak's nod) I knew you'd understand. EXT. “SERPENTINE FIRE" - DAY 56 Where Trish returns from shopping, a bundle of bags and packages in her hands. She passes a silently steaming Maurice and Driver on the way in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Trish enters to find an uncomfortable look on Lori's face...

dialogues.speaker: LORI
dialogues.text: Colin's in the back. A disappointed beat. Trish moves for the storeroom, parting the set of tie-dyed curtains to discover Colin mid-conversation on the office phone. He's Trish's little brother, Isaak‘s son. The same guy we saw earlier at the Casino.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: You know that Chinese cat got whacked?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: You mean Po Sung?

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Po somethin' or other. Anyway, that's what I wanna tell you... (lower now) I got a call from him that night. No bullshit -- same night he got killed.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: Jesus, boy -- What did he want?

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: That's what I can't figure, Dad. Never got a chance to meet him...

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: Mac better hear this. See if we can figure out what it's all about... Colin looks up to find Trish. Abruptly...

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Gotta go, Dad. Call me back at my place. He HANGS UP. Big sister's face is not happy.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: I asked you not to do your business here. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Forgot. I was in a hurry

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (concerned) I worry about you, Colin. Don't ee seeing you involved in that life.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: (shrugs) He's our father. You can't spend the rest of your life just pretending he ain't.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: He's also a gangster. Drugs, strong-arm stuff... (then, softer) The same kids that come to my store get lost because of guys like him, waste themselves before they really even grow up... (a beat) Why do you think I even opened this place? I wanted them to see a different way than that. A better way. Colin takes up his jacket and stands across from her.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: What if he got murdered ‘cause I knew something and didn't tell? Huh? Or thrown back in? (determined) Right or wrong it's all about family. Qur family. She watches as the curtains close behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Han drives up. Checks the address against Po's crumpled letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Han finds his Brother's place. He takes out a_hand- i i ill and SLOTS THE LOCK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Han at last enters his lost brother's world. He drifts in with the reverence of a churchgoer, drinking in the silent statements of Po's home and belongings.

dialogues.speaker: DESK DRAWERS
dialogues.text: Han expertly searches them, finding little more than old letters and checkbook stubs, the meaningless remnants of our too brief lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where he works through Po's extensive wardrobe. Digging through jacket pockets, then slacks, shaking out pair after pair of expensive shoes. A tattered basketball finds him from the very top shelf. An emotional moment as he eases it down -- Po must have kept it here as a reminder of that defining day on the ocean, and the strength of will it took them to survive.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BATHROOM
dialogues.text: Where Han rifles the medicine cabinet. Systematically dumping prescription bottles into the sink, then rooting through the rainbow of pills looking for something, anything that can help hin. No luck. He goes to work on the shaving kit.

dialogues.speaker: FRAMED PHOTOGRAPHS
dialogues.text: Ride along the living room wall. Various images covering the spectrum of the dead man's experience -- hanging out with hotties at Fisherman's Wharf, leaning against a car with a hot blonde tucked under each arm... Qne picture in particular monopolizes Han's attention. It shows Han and Po hugging tightly from the brink of adulthood -- Han wearing his police cadet uniform, Po a stylish jacket for Hong Kong of the time. The sadness of his loss cuts deep here. Han sets the picture down, face a quiltwork of difficult emotion. Then his policeman's eyes cheat to...

dialogues.speaker: THE PHONE
dialogues.text: A fancy Caller I.D. unit. He ZEROES IN ON the "Redial" button. Pushes it. A number appears across the large digital display. As he lifts the receiver to his ear... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LORI (v.a.) Good evening. Serpentine Fire. WE HOLD ON HIS REACTION as he HANGS UP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Trish is staring into her lonely dinner, Maurice and partner watching her from the front entrance. The door OPENS AND CLOSES. She looks up to finda smiling Mac beside her...

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: What's good here?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (not interested) Try the parking lot. He lets it slide off, pulling out a chair to sit down.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: I'm doing my job, girl. Just like Mo... {off her reaction) Yeah, he told me about the shit you pulled yesterday. Plain stupid is what it was. Things are real tense since that Chinese dude got popped.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Was that one of your jobs too?

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: That's not my style.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Don't tell me -- I've got you all wrong.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: You don't have a clue what I'm about. For starters, you've got to get past the facade.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH 7
dialogues.text: You've got some serious facade going on.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: So do you, so does everybody. This icy-hearted B-girl shit isn't you. Not the real you. Saving yourself for some TV Dream Dude is just a waste of good woman...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: eae 62

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Is that what you think I'm doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's time to consider the eee you've already met him.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (point-blank) You're an errand boy for my father, Mac. Nothing more, nothing less.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Fair enough. But time comes when aman has to strike out on his own, hear what I'm saying? Stake his own claim.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: You've sold me, Mac, I just realized I'm hopelessly in love with you...

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: (bristling) Trash-talk me all you like. Sooner or later this man here is gonna be too much for you. You'll start getting all misty eyed, wishing there were two of me. She pushes her plate across the table.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Don't bother with the menu -- you can have mine. Suddenly I've lost my appetite. Mac GRABS her arm as she gets up...

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: No more running wild. You gonna do like Isaak wants and let us protect you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the DOOR CLOSES behind Trish. Mac wanders to the front to watch her through the window.

dialogues.speaker: MAURICE
dialogues.text: (snickers) You're really murder on a first date. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Mac rears and BACKHANDS HIM without warning.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: I want Eddie Murphy, I'll go to the goddamned movies. Maurice's fearful nod says he gets it, but good...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where A TELEPHOTO SHOT finds Trish locking up. She head- checks the street and starts off. WE QUICKLY RACK FOCUS TO FIND...

dialogues.speaker: A HIRED TAXI
dialogues.text: PEEKING OUT OF an alley across the street. Han watches from inside. Face slack with amazement at the owner's identity.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: Same thing?

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. Keep following. A beat. They ease on down the block...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Trish climbs up to her apartment loaded down with groceries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Trish enters to set the bags on the eee she turns to lock up and finds t. th It gives her a helluva scare but somehow she contains it shy of crying out.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Hello, Ahkbar. You're the only guy I know working his way down the criminal ladder. First Grand Theft Auto, now trespassing. He crosses to lay a piece of paper before her...

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: This is the last number my brother called before he died. (she reads it) It's the number for your shop. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Yeah, so? I don't even know who your brother is.

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: His name was Po Sung.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: I have absolutely no idea what you're talking about. Why would he want to talk to me? Han's unwavering gaze scours her face, debating the truthfulness of this.

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: He called.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (shrugs) I have a girl who works the register. Maybe it was her. Once in a while my little... Then the name starts to register from her earlier talk with Colin. As the possibility hits her... TRISH (cont'd) ... brother.

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: Brother?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Colin. He makes calls from there sometimes. Mostly when I'm not around.

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: We should talk to him. Have him fill in the blanks. Then THE HYPNOTIC GRIND OF HIP-HOP interrupts them as a car PULLS IN...

dialogues.speaker: AT THE WINDOW
dialogues.text: Where Trish flags the curtains to see Maurice and OTHER CREW bounding out for the stairwell...

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Shit, it's Maurice. He finds you up here and... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: No problem. By the way... (as they stand close together) My name is Han. They connect for an instant as WE HARD CUT TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Maurice and his boys reach the apartment to find...

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: Backing down the stairs doing his best "Chinese Delivery Boy" -- shirt buttoned all the way up, bowing repeatedly and waving his two dollar “tip".

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: (exaggerated accent) Dim sum good. Call again. Dim sum all time...

dialogues.speaker: MAURICE
dialogues.text: (blocks his way) Whoa, whoa, whoa. Why you bothering Ms. O'Day? Huh?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: He's the delivery boy, genius.

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: Dim sum good. Another bow and Han escapes down the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Mo and his dogs shuffle in and look around...

dialogues.speaker: MAURICE
dialogues.text: We kept ringin' and ringin', didn't get no answer. Started my wheels spinning, got me to worrying...

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Well here I am.

dialogues.speaker: CREW
dialogues.text: Say, Mo. You smell somethin' funny?

dialogues.speaker: MAURICE
dialogues.text: Nah, dawg. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CREW
dialogues.text: Me neither. (half beat) So where's the fuckin' take-out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Maurice and Co. rush onto the flight above Han...

dialogues.speaker: MAURICE
dialogues.text: Hey, Dim Sum -- you a real funny man. TWO OTHERS BELOW move to cut off the stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: (gives him an out) Let it go.

dialogues.speaker: MAURICE
dialogues.text: Isaak O'Day don't let things go. He doesn't like the wrong element around his daughter. My business is to insure they ain't. Han eases into fighting stance as they close the gap. A LOW WHISTLE from Maurice. Then he proudly shows-off HIS OWN VARIETY OF HALF-ASSED KARATE MOVES...

dialogues.speaker: MAURICE
dialogues.text: You ain't the only one knows some shit. Half beat. Han drills him with A STRAIGHT RIGHT. Maurice's two front teeth pop out like a pair of Chicklets. Now it's a sitting eight-count for him as Dogs from above and below RUSH IN WITH BATS.

dialogues.speaker: A THIRTY SECOND CLINIC IN HAVING YOUR BUTT KICKED FOLLOWS
dialogues.text: (RER_CURRENT CHOREOGRAPHY). Then Han makes down the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Han enters a narrow corridor of chain-link between buildings.

dialogues.speaker: A FANCY SUV
dialogues.text: SUDDENLY SQUEALS UP and TWO MORE DOGS hop the fence to get at the Chinese. ANOTHER FIGHT Neues (PER CURRENT CHOREOGRAPHY) where Han uses the assembled attackers’ own belts and clothing to defeat them. Ultimately, Maurice is left hanging by his jacket from the chain-link fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Han shuts the door and takes the wheel...

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: Great country. Free cars. He sticks his head out to make eye-contact with Trish WATCHING from her apartment window above. Totally taken with the display she's just seen. en_h FF r i e street a -- SaneaiG the unfortunate side mircore of anyone acain on his left side..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Ch'u is surrounded by THE OTHER FIVE TONG OVERLORDS. Heavy, heavy mojo here. Ancient politics running centuries deep...

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: The Honorable Lao-Tzu was lost to assassination less than a month ago. A grocer”s shop was firebombed, his wife killed...

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: With all respect, Ch'u, more must be done about the blacks. They have no honor. Any of us could be killed at any time, Overlord or mot... A STRONG MURMUR OF AGREEMENT.

dialogues.speaker: CH'U
dialogues.text: None of this is news to me the day I bury my own son. His quiet gravity HUSHES the room... CH'U (cont'd) Who among you hurts as much as I? But we must have the patience to wait until the mud settles and the water is clear.

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: But any of the Overlords could be wiped out, driving the families apart..

dialogues.speaker: CH'U
dialogues.text: Such things are protected against by the our newly-signed alliance. After dear Lao-Tzu's passing, his (MORE) (CONTINUED)

CONTINUED: dae CH'U (cont'd) territory was divided and shared equally among us, was it not? (nods and grunts acknowledge this) This is the case should any of us meet with misfortune. By treaty, our territory stays within the Collective. (sharply) We are not the blacks, Victor. Our loyalty to each other is unquestioned.

dialogues.speaker: OVERLORD
dialogues.text: At least let us strike harder. Show our true strength.

dialogues.speaker: CH'U
dialogues.text: (flatly) No. We will only do that when it serves us best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the viewing of Po's body is taking place. Everything is done very traditionally -- ANCIENT FUNERAL DIRGE, paper money being burned to calm wrathful spirits... THRONGS OF CHINESE pass by the open coffin. Ch'u and Kai watch them from a mourning platform on high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Han appears on a distant bridqe above the glassy waters of the pond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the viewing continues. Then it's Han's turn to step through the shroud of incense to reach the corpse. He stares long and hard at the waxy certainty of his Brother's death. He takes the tattered basketball and tucks it into the coffin. A telling final farewell. Then Han looks up sharply to lock eyes with Ch'u. His father's brow briefly furrows with surprise, but neither face betrays what either man feels inside... INT. CH'U SUNG'S MANSION - STUDY - DAY ao Where Han enters to stand opposite his father. Their eyes brimming with the many hard years that have passed since last seeing each other. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CH'U
dialogues.text: Han Sung...

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: (quietly) Father. They share an awkward embrace. The distance between them great, the bond between them eternal, for better or worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Han and his father are now locked in conversation...

dialogues.speaker: CH'U
dialogues.text: (MANDARIN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop punishing me for your choices. You wear this dammed sanctity like a badge...

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: (MANDARIN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have never regretted what I did for Po.

dialogues.speaker: CH'U
dialogues.text: (MANDARIN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nor should you. You were a policeman who allowed his brother to escape a State Death in Hong Kong. The Family found great honor there, even though you were never proud of this...

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: (MANDARIN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not proud, no.

dialogues.speaker: CH'U
dialogues.text: (MANDARIN, shrugs) There is God's Law and man's law. You've always well understood the difference between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which law told you to abandon your sons on the Mainland? To flee alone at night, forcing them to find their own way to Hong Kong...

dialogues.speaker: CH'U
dialogues.text: (breaks into ENGLISH) Thad no choice. The Communists would have killed me... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He realizes that Han has gotten to him. Pauses to regain his composure...

dialogues.speaker: CH'U
dialogues.text: (MANDARIN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't expect you've come to make your claim as successor.

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: (MANDARIN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No father, I want Po's killer.

dialogues.speaker: CH'U
dialogues.text: (MANDARIN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have honored him properly, and that is enough. Kai will take care of it now, he is the family enforcer.

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: (MANDARIN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We shall see. The cold man calls out to halt Han's exit. His face worried and sallow...

dialogues.speaker: CH'U
dialogues.text: Han. I do not want to lose another son. (slow beat) This is not China. Here justice wears a different face. ia EXT. KAI'S ROOFTOP - DAY wi Where Kai is practicing a kata -- running through a pattern of prescribed movements against imagined attackers. His sunglasses flaring brightly in the afternoon sun. Han watches this from a distance. Kai finishes his routine and joins him...

dialogues.speaker: KAI
dialogues.text: The old man didn't think you'd make it, Han Sung.

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: And you?

dialogues.speaker: KAL
dialogues.text: I knew you would. Despite the hard exterior, Kai can see Han struggling deeply with the weight of what's transpired... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: Tell me.

dialogues.speaker: KAL
dialogues.text: He had a row in a black club. I bailed him out, but threats had already been made. (anger building) They got Po that same evening before I could find him again...

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: Why there?

dialogues.speaker: KALI
dialogues.text: Wouldn't tell me. But that makes no difference now...

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: These blacks. Why war with them?

dialogues.speaker: WATERFRONT DISTRICT
dialogues.text: Where a panoramic view of the waterfront rolls out behind them. A thick blanket of homes and buildings run the flatlands to the Bay. KAI (cont'd) It's only two square miles, the waterfront. (motions) They control west of the line -- everything east is ours. By muscling Chinese they hope to take what belongs to us.

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: (sotto) Only so many rats in a cage before they start tearing each other apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Kai removes his sunglasses and moves into a stance opposite Han. Han grins at the invitation and quickly enjoins him in A FRIENDLY EXCHANGE... WE FOLLOW THEM across the roof -- THRUST... THRUST... BLOCK... STRIKE... PARRY... Kai SUDDENLY FOOT-SWEEPS and follows Han down, poised for the kill shot. For the first and only time now we see Kai smile as he helps his opponent up... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: af 78 a7

dialogues.speaker: KAI
dialogues.text: I was afraid Hsing-Kang would make you soft. Han smiles too, opening his hand to reveal...

dialogues.speaker: KAI'S SUNGLASSES
dialogues.text: Resting in the palm. He casually hands them back.

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: People don't get soft in prison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where A FOOTBALL GAME is taking place. Mac, Maurice and a bunch of the crew having it out five-on-four... Trish sits across the grass eating lunch with SEVERAL NEIGHBORHOOD KIDS. An ice cream truck arrives at the park and she leads a few of them over...

dialogues.speaker: AT THE TRUCK
dialogues.text: Where Trish now tries to balance a half-dozen cones for the kids. Han has materialized beside her in line as she turns...

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: That's quite an appetite.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Nice to see you again, too. She looks out to the football game, distracted... TRISH (cont'd) I think maybe you're in the wrong part of town.

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: May-be. But I wanted to hear what your brother said.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Haven't gotten a hold of him yet.

dialogues.speaker: VIEW OF
dialogues.text: Dropping back in the pocket to pass. His eyes chance across Trish talking with the Chinese. The game goes on pause as he makes for them... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (reacting) This isn't good. The guy coming over is on a real short fuse. He works for my father.

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: What's his name?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Mac.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Isaak's right-hand man reaches them. He plays it cool, the smiling killer, casing Han with a friendly glance...

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: (nodding) Say, Trish. Who this?

dialogues.speaker: THE CREW
dialogues.text: Watches the exchange going down. WE'RE SHOOTING FROM BEHIND MAURICE so his face CAN'T BE SEEN...

dialogues.speaker: CREW
dialogues.text: Say, ain't that the guy...

dialogues.speaker: CREW
dialogues.text: Hell, yes it is. Same one took Mo's whip after he beat our...

dialogues.speaker: MAURICE
dialogues.text: Who you talking about? Maurice TURNS INTO CAMERA. He's a walking billboard for bad dentistry now -- wearing poorly-fitting caps where Han knocked his teeth out. MAURICE (cont'd) That him, alright.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: We just met in line. I don't even know his name...

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: My friends call me "Ahkbar”.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: That right, Ahkbar? Well check this. We playing football and we (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: MAC (cont'd) aman short. Think you can help us out?

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: I don't know the game.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: (sticks the ball in Han's chest) Hell, it's easier than breathing. I'll show you. Mac shoots Trish a look of extreme displeasure as he leads Han onto the grass...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE FIELD
dialogues.text: Where the crew is quietly freaking...

dialogues.speaker: CREW
dialogues.text: Should we tell Mac?

dialogues.speaker: MAURICE
dialogues.text: And what? Have him kick our ass toc for fucking up? Nah... just follow his lead. Mac motions his boys to take their positions...

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Fellas, got myself a fresh recruit. He's new to the game -- so take it easy on him. (to Han) Just stand behind me, I'll give you the ball and you run for the far end of the field.

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: That's all?

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: That's all. The. ball is SNAPPED.and handed-off to Han. His blockers quit at the line of scrimmage -- allowing the defense to SAVAGELY DOG-PILE him into the turf. Han gets up and tries to shake it off. Rejoins his team.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Good job. Now you playing football. (a beat) Go long this time. I'll pass it to you. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Second down. Han gets HAMSTRUNG cutting downfield... somehow rights himself... then takes A MONSTER RONNIE LOTT-STYLE HIT from two defenders as he goes up for the pass... SMAACCK! They dump him head-first into the tur€.

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: (stumbling back) How come nobody else gets hit?

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: (smiling) "Cause you the one with the ball, brother. Third down. Han takes the pill and bolts straight at Maurice. The thug is about to lower the boom when Han dd hh him the ball. A stunned beat as he catches it. Then Han comes flying in with A BONE-CRUSHING TACKLE. Regains the ball...

dialogues.speaker: MAURICE
dialogues.text: (in the aftermath) I think he broke my arm.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN THE FIELD
dialogues.text: As the Chinese goes for it -- CREAMING one would-be tackler after another. WE BRIEFLY FIND TRISH smiling her ass off on the sidelines... Han reaches the goal line. Stops and turns. This halts the crippled stragglers giving chase dead in their tracks. They back up. Han enjoys this, smiles. Then steps across the goal line.

dialogues.speaker: BAN
dialogues.text: Good game, this football. He SUCCINCTLY SPIKES THE BALL. A beat. The awed defenders watch as it LOUDLY DEFLATES.

dialogues.speaker: PASSING TRISH
dialogues.text: As Han walks off the field... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: (not asking, telling) It's time to get some answers from your brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Also watching him go. To say he's seething is to put it politely...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Colin and his GIRLFRIEND are making a nice dinner. The scene here is surprisingly domestic -- Krups coffee maker, sushi machine, the works... His girl wears a bathrobe, Colin ranting around the room in just sweatpants...

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: It's like they don't think I can handle my own business...

dialogues.speaker: GIRLFRIEND
dialogues.text: (on auto-pilot, heard it all before) Um hum.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: My father's got to realize I'm cut from the same cloth. He's gotta start respecting my manhood...

dialogues.speaker: GIRLFRIEND
dialogues.text: Um hum.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Like that call I got. I try and do the right thing, help hin out... Hell, I never even hear back... The DOOR BUZZES. She wipes her hands on a towel...

dialogues.speaker: GIRLFRIEND _
dialogues.text: I'll get it. You watch this stuff.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: (calling after her) When is it gonna be my turn to get busy, that's what I want to know? When do I run the show?

dialogues.speaker: GIRLFRIEND
dialogues.text: Don't worry, baby -- your turn's coming. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: AT THE FRONT DOOR
dialogues.text: Where the girlfriend smiies as she peers through the security viewhole. Pulling the door open wide..

dialogues.speaker: GIRLFRIEND
dialogues.text: (warmly) Ain't this is somethin'. What you doin' all the way down here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where we're looking up fifteen stories of mirrored glass windows. Long beat. Then...

dialogues.speaker: THE GIRLFRIEND
dialogues.text: PLOD. ° lin's a 2: i TR OF GLASS. WE WATCH as she starts her sickening drop. Half beat. Then...

dialogues.speaker: COLIN
dialogues.text: Comes flying out right behind her -- tied to a dining room chair, face wearing all the hallmarks of a fearsome beating. Ladies first, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the couple seems to fall forever before HITTING THE WATER and CANNONBALLING into the depths... THE CAMERA NOW SETTLES ON the Bay roiling and frothing at the point of impact. And then WE MATCH CUT TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Colin's body is being dredged from the same waters. WE PULL BACK to see the POLICE DIVERS and WINCH OPERATORS... then FURTHER STILL to unveil several police boats circled around them. The corpse is eased onto a deck. That boat then GUNNING FOR SHORE followed by AN AERIAL SHOT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Colin's body is ferried ashore, A FULL-BLOWN CRIME SCENE now surrounding the landing.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK --
dialogues.text: Watches the grisly proceedings from the back of a police cruiser. An odd moment where we think he’s been arrested (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: -- tnen he OPENS THE DOOR himself, driven there simply as the father of the deceased.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH --
dialogues.text: Stands across the street, enraged, knowing Isaak's wrong living is somehow responsible for this terrible tragedy.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH AND ISAAK
dialogues.text: Moving together as Colin's corpse is finally set down to be covered by the paramedics...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say anything to the police, I'll handle that. His daughter finds herself simply overcome by grief...

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: I never wanted him mixed up in your dealings. I told him that just as many times as I told

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: You think I'm not dying right now? Inside? Believe me girl -- ian. You two are ali I've ever had in this world. (fights to reign it in) But this is a family concern -- I don't need nobody doesn't go by the name O'Day involved. (a blending of anger and sorrow) He's my boy and I'll take care of it my way.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (flaring) You had a hand in this, Isaak, you're every bit as responsible. You might as well have thrown him out yourself.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: Goddamnit, Trish. Listen to me... But she strides off, leaving him there to face these demons alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Mac SQUEALS UP and hurries out to join his boss... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: Where the fuck you been? I've been trying to track you down for hours...

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Where I always am -- taking care cf your acquisitions for Ivan Roth. WE WATCH Isaak falter, unable to maintain the hard exterior now as he's faced with the first true wave of inconsolable regret.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: c, he had him killed. That wrinkled piece of shit Ch'u Sung killed my Colin.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: I know where your head's at, Isaak, and God knows you've got cause. But we in shit way too deep now to pull out. (pumping him up) You gotta keep it stitched up until your business is done. Certain motherfuckers gonna got knocked out the box in due time. Isaak lets this advice hang there. Starts a slow nod, realizing his how right his lieutenant is.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: Either way, Ch'u just bought himself a one-way ticket to the apocalypse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Han arrives to some bad news. The front door has been broken open. Looks like somebody sledgehammered it, nearly rocking it off the hinges. Han drifts through the wreckage of his brother's home. E has been ransacked and turned inside-out. Looking for what, Han has no idea.

dialogues.speaker: THE PHOTOGRAPH
dialogues.text: cli . Frame shattered, surface of the Brine Seeoly scarred: Han picks it up and shards of glass SPILL ABSENTLY onto the floor. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He fights to suck it up now, as broken as the keepsake itself. Fighting to overcome the emotion that will siphon away his strength. A long moment. Then his policeman's eyes notice...

dialogues.speaker: THE OTHER PHOTOS
dialogues.text: Still hanging crooked on the walls. He goes to them immediately, taking down the one of Po with the blonde astride his car. The make and model can't clearly be made out from the picture. That's what he's overlooked.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Where Han's fo eae ferret through Po's discarded slacks to find a ring of keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Han faces a line of cars filling the garage. But where to start? He thinks for a minute -- then DEACTIVATES Po's alarm using the button on the key ring. Its TELLTALE BLEETING singles out his brother's Austin- Martin.

dialogues.speaker: THE TRUNK
dialogues.text: Han SPRINGS IT and searches. SLAMMING THE TRUNK LID when he finishes...

dialogues.speaker: THE INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Where he EMPTIES the glove compartment and ashtray, FLIPS DOWN the sun visors. During this entire sequence we realize he's got the hands of any cop -- fast, thorough and completely focused, Then he ducks his head down to look under the seats...

dialogues.speaker: PO'S CANE
dialogues.text: Lays on the back seat floorboards. Having settled there the night Po threw it inside. Han reaches around to retrieve it. ROTATES the bone handle of his brother's cane back to reveal the coke Stash. His face flashes with disappointment -- not the kind of shit he'd hoped to find. The handle is then ROTATED BACK THE OTHER WAY. It RELEASES as he takes it a notch too far, revealing... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: A LIST OF ADDRESSES
dialogues.text: Staring back from inside. He fishes it out and examines the heavy scrawl. (sotto) Po's handwriting. Han slowly looks them over, no apparent order or meaning to the bunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Han now returns to his brother's apartment to find Trish awaiting him on the couch. Her feet stir aimlessly through the splintered carnage...

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: (concerned) What is it? What's happened?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (without lookin up) Once Colin and I did something we thought'd be really funny. He hid out front while I ran to tell Mom he'd been hurt, hit by a car or something bad like that. When she came running, Colin was supposed to jump out and surprise her and then we'd all have a good laugh. My mother, she always loved a good laugh... (pauses) I was only eight or nine, Colin younger, and I don't even remember how we came up with it. But sure enough, I started yelling and she rushed outside. (softly) And when I told her, I mean, the look on her face... She was just erushed, totally destroyed. She collapsed right there in the yard, weeping, broken... (slow beat) Even when Colin showed her it was a joke she wouldn't stop. It had shaken her too deeply. Even as she clutched him there, safe and sound, it was too much.

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: Trish... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: I was just a little girl, Han. I didn't get it yet. I didn't get ac. Han quickly moves to comfort her, kneeling at her side.

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: How did it happen?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Threw him right out his window. Fifteen stories up...

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: (anger rising) No leads at all, no witnesses... She shakes her head. Then...

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: I want to help you, Han, I need it. I have to put this thing together just as much as you do now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Roth roams while talking on his headset. His offices are as quietly luxurious as they come -- a wall of Citizenship Awards and a view of the Bay from twenty stories up...

dialogues.speaker: ROTH
dialogues.text: (into headset) Gentlemen -- I just found out the NFL officially approved our bid about an hour ago. (listens to the wash of approval) Tell the truth, Frank, I don't think any of the other bids were even in contention. We offered prime time waterfront here, seconds from the Bridge. God Himself couldn't have designed a more perfect place for a stadium. (empty business laugh) That's right, Barry, you know me well. If I say there's caviar on the mountain, you better bring crackers... THE CAMERA SLOWLY DRIFTS BY HIM to discover... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: AN ARCHITECTURAL MODEL
dialogues.text: Of a_new footbali stadium sits in the window. THE CAMERA FORCES PERSPECTIVE (DOLLY IN/ZOOM OUT) to magnify the illusion it's built atop the waterfront below... HELMETS AND OTHER ACCOUTREMENT bearing the new teams! elegant logo are casually displayed around it. The silent fruit of Ivan's detailed and long-running planning...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Ch'u sits at the head of a marvelous luncheon. Kai enters and speaks into his ear...

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Ivan Roth, His smile never wavering, Ch'u excuses himself from the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Ch'u takes the call, Kai standing anxiously at his side...

dialogues.speaker: CH'U
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: ROTH
dialogues.text: You don't want to be downwind of me when my feet are put to the coals, Ch'u. Misery loves company.

dialogues.speaker: CH'U
dialogues.text: There's no need for threats or theatrics, Ivan. None of us want to drag this out any longer than it already has.

dialogues.speaker: ROTH
dialogues.text: So close out your business and get me the remaining deeds.

dialogues.speaker: CH'U
dialogues.text: I'm already wrapping up... Ivan HANGS UP. Ch'u cradles the phone and shares a look with Kai.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chinese side of the line. THE CAMERA PANS ALONG a desolate block of real estate -- homes abandoned, most of the barren shops shuttered.

dialogues.speaker: HAN'S FACE
dialogues.text: Studies this in shadow from across the street, Trish at his side. His questioning eyes work it over, playing through the chessboard in his mind. Several addresses are marked off Po's list, a few new ones jotted down...

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: I don't understand. They're just Waterfront addresses.

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: Whatever they mean, Po didn't want them found. Stashed them good enough that they wouldn't be.

dialogues.speaker: A SMALL CHINESE BOY
dialogues.text: Plays alone on the sidewalk. The kid shades his eyes as Han comes over to offer him a stick of gum.

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: (MANDARIN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you playing?

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: (MANDARIN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Army.

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: (MANDARIN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are your friends? They should be playing with you.

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: (MANDARIN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moved away.

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: (MANDARIN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can't all be gone.

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: (MANDARIN, absently) Yeah. Everyone's moved away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Han and Trish drive through A BUSTLING CHINESE NEIGHBORHOOD in contrast to what we've just seen. Trish finds herself gazing out the window. This is a whole new world to her -- a part of the city she's never experienced.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Is Hong Kong like this?

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: No. More crowded.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (testing the waters) You were a policeman there?

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Bet your family loved that.

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: It saved them from prison. (off her look) We raided a tanker muling drugs into the city. Evidence tied it to my brother and father.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: You warned them.

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: (nodding) . My father had already gone to America -- the danger was really to Po.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (softer) What did they give you?

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: Forty-two years.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: How long have you been out?

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: Seventy-two hours. Trish reflects. Trying to get her head around the events that have thrown them together... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: We're worlds apart, Han. But our lives seem to have a lot in common...

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: One way for sure -- we've both lost brothers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where a faded Chinese sign confronts them as they ease through the gate. .The grounds are a barren landscape of crushed automobiles, stacked up like so much cordwood... HAN (v.o.) You sure this is right? TRISH (v.o.) That's what the list says -- Forty-forty Driggs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the couple gets out. The yard is CONSPICUOUSLY QUIET -- none of the cranes working, lifts and loaders abandoned. The office is locked. Han considers this. Moves to the door. Takes the handle and starts it SLOWLY GRINDING UPWARD...

dialogues.speaker: LOOKING INSIDE
dialogues.text: Pitch black at first, nothing clearly visible. Then sunlight floods into the bay to reveal...

dialogues.speaker: SIX MURDERED CHINESE WORKMEN
dialogues.text: in 2 e@_ ov . Each wears a tidy bullet hole through the forehead. Trish steps back and starts to dry-heave.

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: (impassively) You better wait outside. She retreats as Han wanders deeper inside. They've stumbled onto a chop shop -- walls honeycombed with auto parts stolen for any make from Cadillac to Hyundai.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where recently-deceased owner VICTOR HO (Overlord #1) sits upright -- the swimsuit calendar behind him spackled with most of his head. We recognize him from the big meeting with Ch'u. Han lays a hand on Ho's throat. The body is stiil warm. Looks down. A fumbled cigar STILL SMOULDERS on the floor. As it hits him, CAR ENGINES ERUPT OUTSIDE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Han rushes out to find THE KILLERS escaping, faces hidden. He and Trish must have stumbled onto them just as they had finished and were ready to leave... A MOTORCYCLE bring up the rear. Han leaps into the sedan to follow...

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: (to Trish) Get out...

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: (resigned) Then get down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Han slaloms the pavement, playing bump and run with THE HELMETED RIDER... The cyclist withdraws an automatic and CUTS LOOSE with a ribbon of bullets. Han shoves Trish protectively under the dash...

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: ..-and stay down.

dialogues.speaker: THE CHASE
dialogues.text: As Han PEGS THE ACCELERATOR and SLICES into the left lane to pull even. Parked doors and side mirrors are once again SHEERED OFF with abandon... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: A STATION WAGON
dialogues.text: Floats into the intersection ahead. Han sees it first and jerks the wheel... But the cyclist isn't as lucky, being hurled off the bike as they COLLIDE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cyclist TUCKS AND ROLLS onto the cement, Han flying out to meet them. A beat as they circle. Then the helmet comes off. The rider is a woman -- a Chinese woman .

dialogues.speaker: HAN 7
dialogues.text: (hesitates in surprise) You're Chinese.

dialogues.speaker: CYCLIST
dialogues.text: No shit. She uses the opening to ROUNDHOUSE HIM. AN ALL-OUT BRAWL FOLLOWS. Believe me -- she doesn't fight like a girl. DRILLING HAN'S ASS all over the street... : At last they break. She pulls her weapon, hungry for the kill-shot, catching Han dead-to-rights... CLICK-CLICK. Her gun is empty.

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: (half beat) You're also out of bullets. Off his HARD RIGHT WE HARD CUT TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Ch'u is going over various documents. A SUDDEN COMMOTION OUTSIDE. The MAID'S VOICE rising in a singsong bark as Han BURSTS through the doors...

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: I just came from Victor Ho's place.

dialogues.speaker: CH'U
dialogues.text: (waves the maid off) He seems to have gotten you a little excited. How is old Victor?

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: Let's just say business was dead. He and his crew were killed minutes before I got there. (CONTINUED)
98 Cae (considers it, then) O'Day overestimates his power...

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: Ho was hit by Chinese.

dialogues.speaker: CH'U
dialogues.text: Impossible.

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: (shakes head) Very possible. Long beat as Ch'u garners where his son is going with this...

dialogues.speaker: CH'U
dialogues.text: yu. all i 2 other families were involved?

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Maybe Kai knows something about it? He's a family enforcer -- might have heard something.

dialogues.speaker: CH'U
dialogues.text: No. His loyalty is unrivaled. He would have informed me immediately. (shrewdly, thinking) O'Day could have contracted to outside Chinese, trying to provoke exactly this type of dissent.

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: Now you overestimate his power.

dialogues.speaker: CH'U
dialogues.text: Really? Maybe I should be more concerned with his daughter's. (lets it hang there) You're a fool if you don't think she's involved. Her charms are distorting your thinking. (as his father) Stay away from her, Han, please. I cannot afford such a risk, not with my only remaining son. off Han's REACTION WE MO’ =

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where THE BLACK OWNER stands behind the front desk. A grant deed is spread before the graying man, awaiting his signature.

dialogues.speaker: OWNER
dialogues.text: O'Day said ninety-five.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: And I'm saying eighty-five. (short beat) Think of that extra ten grand as my processing fee. You ain't the only one paid it.

dialogues.speaker: OWNER
dialogues.text: (low, upset) Hate for Isaak to find out. Mac looks at him with a terrible intensity, from some dark galaxy beyond "don't even think about it".

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Yeah you would, partner. Trust me on that. He moves astride the desk. Closes the owner's hand around a pen...
