dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Folks wrong, you know. Life isn't cheap -- it's very, very expensive. (passes the deed across) Now sign the fuckin' paper. Game's on at eight and I don't want to miss it. = End of story. The ballpoint begins its FEARFUL SCRATCHING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ancient garbage scow moored to a vacant pier. WE WATCH as a tricked-out Mercedes arrives. Kai and FOUR BAD-ASSES emerge carrying black gym bags and slip inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hull of the ship opens onto in 1 i glowing like tiny lanterns. The American equivalent of an opium den. Kai and his people make for the back, stepping over LOWLIFE HEADS like so many sacks of trash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The brain center of the joint -- lab, security and money counters stationed together. As KUNG (Overlord #2) embraces Kai warmly...

dialogues.speaker: KAI
dialogues.text: (re: the wealth of heads) Guess they don't care there's a war going on.

dialogues.speaker: KUNG
dialogues.text: Hell, they don't care if the goddamned barge is on fire, (motions him in) This is a treat. What brings you downtown? Kai's men place their bags on the counter and casually UNZIP them...

dialogues.speaker: KAI
dialogues.text: You heard about Victor Ho?

dialogues.speaker: KUNG
dialogues.text: (solemnly) Yeah. We're looking forward to some big time blow-back.

dialogues.speaker: KAL
dialogues.text: That's why we're here. (slow beat) We got a tip this place is going to get hit.

dialogues.speaker: KUNG
dialogues.text: You gotta be shitting me. When? Then ears the contents of the gym bags -- bricks of

dialogues.speaker: KAI
dialogues.text: Right now. Kai kicks A SILENCED ROUND into his chest. His partners take out THE OTHERS the same way... They distribute the explosives and START THE TIMERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Mercedes speeds the Chinese killers off the pier. A beat. Then the building iE FIRE AND GLASS. WE WATCH in horror as A CRACKHEAD stumbles out onto the deck FULLY ABLAZE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Trish sleeps bathed in early morning light. A_gioved hand INCHES INTO FRAME. The slumbering girl seems to sense it drawing closer... SNAPPING AWAKE WITH A START...

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: Ss down ym. ir side. Puts a reassuring hand on his daughter as he pulls the sheet up to cover her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Isaak helps Trish into his Town Car. Hi atches ked_fr di he aliey. He surveys this and realizes where she's being taken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Isaak's car pulls through the gate. Trish stares vacantly out the backseat window. LLi: ref. i of the extravagant home cascading over her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Isaak now sits opposite Trish, immersed in a strangely old-fashioned father-daughter...

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: Han has your mind all knotted up, turned around. These are dangerous times. I want you... I need you to stay away from him.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: I know what I'm doing.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: You don't know anything about what's involved. It's a much bigger picture than some dead Chinese and his brother...

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Po.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: What? 105 106 107 (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: His brother's name was Po. (then, directly) Did you have him killed? I have to know.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: (unwavering) Absolutely not. I had every reason not to do it. Mac enters from the hall.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: You've got a call. (with emphasis) It's important.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: Sorry -- I have to take this. Mac allows himself a long look at Trish before following... The moment they're gone Trish gets up and starts casing the room. ISAAK'S VOICE lilting in from down the hall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Isaak is now on the phone... ISAAK (0.s.) Ivan... Ivan. That's right. It's a done deal. I'il be there tonight with everything you asked for...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where a desk drawer is opened and dug through. Another. But before any real progress is made FOOTSTEPS CAN BE HEARD in the corridor. Trish sits back down... Isaak returns, addressing his daughter with a new sense of urgency as he settles in.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: Never been much good talking to you. There are things I've wanted to say, but everything seems to roll out like a flame-thrower most times... (takes her hand) I'm finishing up something now that will take care of us for the rest of our days. After tonight, things are going to be very Lo (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ISAAK (cont'd) different. I'm washing my hands of all this gangster shit. She studies him dispassionately. Extracts her hand from his.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Excuse me if I don't fall right out of my chair, but I've heard this song too many times. Going all the way back before Mom died.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: (deeply stung) I've made mistakes, Trish, bad mistakes. But on my soul, I'm ready to change. I want you back in my life. I need that most of all.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: So where have you been f the or last fifteen years? What about what I needed or Colin? Each blow seems to strike Isaak physically, his posture mirroring this. TRISH (cont'd) A lifetime of dirt of doesn't wash off that easy, Dad. He gets to his feet. Unable to take anymore.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: Things are going to be different, you have my word. But until I can prove it you'll need to stay here. Certain people may try to hurt me by hurting you -- just like they did with your brother.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Not interested.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: (firmly) Not like you have a choice. Maurice and the boys will be guarding the house. It'll help your old man to breathe a little easier...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Isaak now confers with his lieutenant, right back to business... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TSAAK
dialogues.text: Who's left?

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Just Silk. Says he's ready to sign it over. I'm gonna meet him at the casino this evening.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: Fine. Take the money from the safe and close it out. (directly) Silk and.I go way back, understand? Don't muscle him -- just pay for the deed and meet me at the restaurant. Mac nods his understanding. Not a problem...

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: INT. ISAAK O'DAY'S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - LATE AFTERNOON c Where Maurice and his crew have hopped on the dish to watch the Warriors play L.A. After a particularly sloppy Laker turnover...

dialogues.speaker: CREW
dialogues.text: Kobe ain't shit.

dialogues.speaker: MAURICE
dialogues.text: (mad at the game) Son, you ain't shit. Trish has had her fill of testosterone for one afternoon. Gets up...

dialogues.speaker: MAURICE
dialogues.text: Girl, where you going?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Upstairs for a nap. Maybe take a shower.

dialogues.speaker: MAURICE
dialogues.text: (eyes wavering between her and the screen) Alright, then -- but don't get wise. I will be checking up. Trish shoots him a look like "whatever" on the way up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Trish pushes open the door to her room. She hovers inside for a moment, waiting to hear if she's been followed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Han has returned to keep watch from the perimeter beyond the gate...

dialogues.speaker: VIEW FROM
dialogues.text: As_he spots Trish through her window. He makes an immediate rush for the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Trish still hasn't heard anything. She steps back into the corridor with a nervous glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where she slips inside her father's office, door gently closing behind her. She starts rifling the place -- his desk, shelves, anyplace there might be something of importance. Inside one of the file cabinets...

dialogues.speaker: A HOST OF GRANT DEEDS
dialogues.text: Are piled up, authorizing the release of property ownership. hey're i. i wi etti i att hh She roams over them. Surprised to recognize an address.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (puzzled) Forty-forty Driggs... Then she realizes something else. T ‘x one. She starts to take it when it hits her -- the deed will be missed. In a near panic, she catches sight of the fax machine waiting in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Han has arrived wishing he'd brought some climbing gear -~ she's on the second storey and he doesn't have any way up. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He surveys what's at hand. A sudden smile. Steps back to get a running start...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Han runs up the side of the house in a blur -- PING- PONGING from the grass onto a trash can... trash can to a window sill... window sill to the heavy Colonial awning... awning to reach out and snag the railing of Trish's balcony. He gets a good grip and chins himself up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Maurice has finally soured on the Warrior blow-out.

dialogues.speaker: MAURICE
dialogues.text: We down twenty-two? This ain't even a game anymore. He looks over his shoulder and decides to do some checking up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where a_ copy of the unsigned deed is SPITTING OUT of the fax machine. Maurice CAN SUDDENLY BE HEARD out on the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Trish slips back inside. Han steps out from behind the door to give her a_scare. He rushes to quiet her and they end up STUMBLING BACKWARDS onto the bed. Long beat. The couple now checking each other out nose- to-nose from the prone position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Maurice rolls up to Trish's door and KNOCKS. No response. DOES IT AGAIN.

dialogues.speaker: MAURICE
dialogues.text: {on edge now) Yo, Trish. Qpen up. Short beat. Then to our surprise, it does. Trish sheltering herself behind it shyly, wearing nothing but a kowel .

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (impatiently) Yes? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The SOUND OF THE SHOWER drifts out. The thug reigns himself in, realizing he's been overreacting.

dialogues.speaker: MAURICE
dialogues.text: Oh... sorry...

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Water's getting cold. See you in a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she EASES THE DOOR CLOSED in his face. Han peeks out from the bathroom to make sure it's clear. From the balcony, he wonders at getting them down. An idea strikes him. He proudly turns to find Trish still ng. Han windmills into a Buster Keaton pirouette -- almost knocking himself over trying not to see her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where WE WATCH a knotted bed sheet uncoil over the railing. Han lowers himself down first. Then holds the rope for a beaming Trish. They ROCKET across the grounds into safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Overlord #3 and TWO OLD CHINESE BUDDIES sit dead- center watching The Wizard of Oz -- the print BADLY LOOPED IN CHINESE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FEMALE USHER arrives with refreshments, wading down the aisle to serve them. Overlord #3 grants her a lascivious smile as he takes the drinks and popcorn. She smiles back, then PLUNGES...

dialogues.speaker: A KNIFE
dialogues.text: RIGHT INTO HIS HEART. He GASPS HARSHLY, blood rushing into his mouth. The others push back in terror as she DESCENDS ON THEM NEXT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the assassin strides out and lets the murder weapon CLATTER to the ground...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A traditional parlor of delicate paper lanterns and lacquered wood. Ch'u drinks his green tea quietly -- THE TERRIFIED WAITING STAFF hovering over the shoulder of this great and powerful man. One of Kai's cadre enters to bows respectfully...

dialogues.speaker: CADRE
dialogues.text: He's here. Ch'u nods and leaves the house a clip of Chinese currency. The waiters' heads see-saw up and down in gratitude and relief...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where STEADICAM FOLLOWS the Overlord and his escort through the bowels of the restaurant. A DOZEN CHINESE ILLEGALS slave away over steaming and simmering kettles back here, racking bales of tea into large holding bins. They sense Ch'u's presence but dare not look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where STEADICAM CONTINUES out into the back-street. A Sung Meat Company truck idles there, Kai and his men waiting beside it. Ch'u motions and Kai THROWS THE DOORS WIDE. Leads his boss up the ramp into the refrigeration car...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where they part a jungle of frozen pig carcasses on bloody hooks to find... THE FINAL OVERLORDS (#4 and #5) Hanging upside-down in the front of the car. They dangle helplessly, mouths gagged, eyes dark and wild with fear...

dialogues.speaker: H'U
dialogues.text: Go peacefully, dear brothers. You are the last of them, and when you pass your territory will remain within the Collective. The Overlords' throat strains with MUFFLED PLEAS. Ch'u regards them with a detached smile. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CH'U (cont'd) Of course, since I alone survive, the Collective is in actuality only me. (savors it) Which makes all the property mine. He steps back and signals Kai. The heavy blade of a hatchet is hefted into the light.

dialogues.speaker: CH'U
dialogues.text: I'll inform Mister Roth that his property has been cleared. Ch'u exits and the truck doors SHUT behind him, drowning out SOME TERRIBLE SOUNDS as WE HARD CUT TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Trish is now at the wheel. Han pours over the copied deed, his brow wrinkling with concern...

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: This was the only one that wasn't signed over yet. (thinking) I also noticed a deed for Victor Ho's place. Han takes out his list and cross-references the new document against it.

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: This address matches the last entry on Po's list. I already checked the others -- they've either been cleared out or sold.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: That's a helluva lot of property changing hands. Hard to believe. He holds out the deed so she can read it...

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: Where is this?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Silk's casino down on the Bay. (holds his gaze) It's the last place your brother was seen the night he died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where from the looks of the parking lot, the party never stops. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Trish leads Han to the front. TWO BOUNCERS give the Chinese a real nasty glare, more than ready to bust his hole when Trish intercedes...

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (sweetly) He's with me, guys.

dialogues.speaker: BOUNCER
dialogues.text: (hesitates, then) You Isaak's girl?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: That's right. They don't like it, but don't want to chance any trouble with her old man either. Decide to let her chaperon Han inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where THE PATRONS ARE GAMBLING AND DANCING IN A CYCLONE OF NOISE AND BOOZE. Trish approaches the main booth. The ELDERLY CASHIER looks out at her with stony eyes.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: I want to see Silk. (no response) Tell him Trish O'Day is here. The woman disappears into the back without comment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Trish and Han now stand waiting. She notices THE BEVY OF HOSTILE STARES coming from all directions. This place is way too hot for any Chinese to be making the scene right now -- especially Han. To get out from under the magnifying glass, Trish drags Han...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE DANCE FLOOR
dialogues.text: ..,and starts them DANCING. She's fantastic, sliding right into the sexy, urgent flow of the DJ's HOUSE MUSIC. Han's gonna need a few lessons however, moving with all the rhythm of Gilbert Godfrey... She LAUGHS as she helps to guide him. Gently bumping him with her backside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Silk watches her on the bank of color monitors lining his suite. Walls of one-way glass run the length or coe room affording a view of both the casino and bar sides..: He also notices the BRISTLING CROWD around them.

dialogues.speaker: SILK
dialogues.text: (to himself) What in the hell is she doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Han feels a_ large hand clamp down on his shoulder. Ready for the worst, he spins around to find...

dialogues.speaker: SILK
dialogues.text: Smiling at them as he motions to follow. Defusing a potentially riotous situation in his club in the process... INT. WATERFRONT CASINO - SILK‘S OFFICE - LATER 135 Where SILK'S BODYGUARD watches the three of them talking, Silk now going over Han's list...

dialogues.speaker: SILK
dialogues.text: And you're saying these places have already been hit?

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: (nodding) Victor Ho's was the last. He-was taken down this afternoon. The owner's face is etched with a deep concern. Looks directly to Trish...

dialogues.speaker: SILK
dialogues.text: You're absolutely sure about this, girl?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Yeah, Silk. Yours isn't the only black property that was targeted. All the others have been bought up or burned out by now... Silk pauses before shaking his head in approval. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SILK
dialogues.text: This is very, very disturbing. I'm glad you brought it to my attention. (slow beat) I'm not a man who likes to worry. He moves to OPEN the office door opposite...

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON
dialogues.text: Walking through, having listened in on the entire exchange. The angle of his gun runs a plum-line straight through Han's heart...

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Damned if you haven't nearly put it all together. Pretty impressive for a guy barely speaks the language.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Let's talk to my father. See what he says about it.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Fuck your father. Like I said -- time comes when a man has to stake -his own claim.

dialogues.speaker: SILK
dialogues.text: (one-track mind) Yo, Mac. You bring my money? Mac takes the unsigned grant deed from his breast pocket and passes it across. His eyes never leaving Han.

dialogues.speaker: SILK
dialogues.text: (reviewing document) Right there?

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Right there. Silk takes up his pen and signs, finishing with a flourish. Greedy hands rub together in anticipation...

dialogues.speaker: SILK
dialogues.text: You got yours, brother, now where's mine? Mac hefts a suitcase onto the counter and Silk jacks the clasps. Six hundred thousand in bundled hundreds is nestled inside. Mac turns to SILK'S BODYGUARD while the owner stands salivating. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Yo, Jerome -- Nice suit.

dialogues.speaker: JEROME
dialogues.text: Thanks Mac... THWUMPP! Mac fires a bullet right through his forehead. He pancakes face-first onto the counter. The lieutenant PISTOL-WHIPS Silk to the floor before he can react. THWUMPP! Serves him up a fat round as well.

dialogues.speaker: FAVORING HAN
dialogues.text: Knowing that this offers their only chance at survival. He STUTTER-STEPS FORWARD and PINS Mac's gun hand to the glass with one foot... Lowers the boom on him with A SAVAGE FOREARM to the temple. He grabs Trish and starts for the stairs..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the couple makes a measured march for the exits...

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: Play it cool. We'll walk right out. But they're not halfway there before a monkey wrench gets heaved into their plans. Mac stumbles out to the staircase astride Silk's office...

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: (pointing)

dialogues.speaker: SILK...
dialogues.text: Dead silence is a tragic understatement. Han and Trish immediately find their escape cut off by THE MEAN-ASSED CROWD. .

dialogues.speaker: THREE BOUNCERS
dialogues.text: Rush out to grab them. First mistake -- one makes a grab for Han's shoulder. Han intercepts him and SEVERELY TORQUES HIS WRIST. WINDMILLS him into a partner... A third brings a high-voltage cattle-prod to the show. He THRUSTS OUT. Han uses one fluid motion to strip him of the prod and DRIVE IT back into his side... ZABAP! The big fella is di The big fella_is danced around in A SPASTIC TWITCH. With a quick look, Han realizes they'll have to backtrack... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: (to Trish) Folio le. Now COMPLETE AND UTTER PANDEMONIUM FOLLOWS -- PEOPLE YELLING AND STAMPEDING INTO A MOB SCENE...

dialogues.speaker: AT THE ROULETTE WHEEL
dialogues.text: Where ONE OF THE GAMBLERS sees profit in disaster. He changes the ball from the number where it stopped to the xv his mountai. bait is ridi .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Mac ducks back inside to pocket the signed grant deed and liberate the Six Hundred Large...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Han and Trish fight their way towards the open DJ booth, the Chinese using A VARIETY OF MANEUVERS ACROSS THE TABLES (PER CHOREOGRAPHY)to force back the crowd and get them there... They scale the stairs at last, MORE OF SILK'S SECURITY right on their heels. Passing THE OPEN-MOUTHED DJ they slip through a_small service door into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..-Which leads to the roof. The rungs are THUNDERED UP two at a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hatch POPS OPEN and they scramble onto the flat tar surface. A quick look around. Three stories up now without a lot of options for getting down. Han runs the far side. Discovers a wall of scaffolding against the Bay side of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Silk's men follow now brandishing serious artillery...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Han and Trish LEAP onto the scaffolding. The metal webbing TEETERS PRECARIOUSLY under their weight.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (stomach drops) Ohm Corist..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 142 dae

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Silk's a: appears roof BLAZIN

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON
dialogues.text: Winci in agony a: he meat is arm i ii a -9mm_ slug. Somehow he manages to grab the top bar and SWING UNDER IT -- DRIVING both legs into the side of the building, then PUSHING OFF with all nis strength...

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: Hang_on. The entire structure LURCHES FREE. Beginning to TOPPLE SICKENINGLY for the water...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Silk's men are forced to pull up, realizing they'll never make it in time. - However ONE OF THEM decides to go for the brass ring -- sprinting to the edge and making a_spectacular leap through the air. He catches the scaffolding on its way down... Han watches him, greatly intrigued. Even as they drop, the soldier locks an arm around a bar and goes free-hand for his gatt... A smile of encouragement from the Chinese. The guy realizes this isn't good. Looks down sharply...

dialogues.speaker: A PAIR OF RICKETY DOCKS
dialogues.text: Loom up at him from below. Han and Trish don't have that problem -- hanging free and clear over the water. Half beat. Just long enough to realize he should have stayed home with his old lady. The scaffolding CRASHES into the docks. It PULVERIZES HIM and SLINGSHOTS Han and Trish into the water...

dialogues.speaker: FOLLOWING
dialogues.text: ivi (ol i i we t: i re the safety of the Bay. INT. “TOP OF THE FIVES" RESTAURANT - NIGHT 143 A classy eatery reserved in its entirety for Ivan Roth. Tonight he acquires the deeds which bring his stadium dream to fruition, and something that big warrants a celebration. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ROTH'S BODYGUARDS allow Ch'u and Kai to enter. The real estate magnate rises to warmly greet him, taking two champagnes from a tray...

dialogues.speaker: ROTH
dialogues.text: Crystal, Ch'u? (sees him vacillate) My friend, you only live once... Put that way the Overlord decides to take him up on it. Glasses conspiratorially CLINKING TOGETHER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where an ostentatious "Q'DAY ENTERPRISES" placard runs the gold-plated facade. Han and Trish furtively arrive out front. She quickly keys them inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The professional suite where Isaak's legitimate business interests are overseen. Trish and Han recover here from their near-death escape. They've been through the ringer tonight and it shows -- hair trashed, clothes still damp, a cornucopia of cuts and abrasions shared between them. Han notices a surveyors map of the Waterfront pulled down across one wall. Grids cleanly parceling the land into zoning districts.

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: I need a pen.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (motions) Look in that desk. Han is digging one out when she notices...

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Take your jacket off.

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Take it off. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He hesitates briefly before peeling it away. Blood has lete mushroomed throu his long-sleeved irt. That jagged little .9mm wound refusing to clot up.

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: Leave it...

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (fat chance) Come over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where she leads him to the indu ial-si fice aid kit in the kitchenette. Starts the sink filling with hot water. She SCISSORS his sleeve to examine the damage more closely. Nasty stuff -- Marrow entry, gaping exit. The good news is it passed right through.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: You don't seem too bothered. Not the first time you've been shot, huh?

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: (smiles) Not even the second. SHARP HISS as peroxide meets wound. Trish empties a pack of fiberglass powder into the water. Wraps his arm in dry gauze first, then a second dressing dipped in the starchy concoction... It hardens instantly. Han STARTS IN SURPRISE as she RAPS her knuckles on the bandage -- now a cast as solid as a piece of wood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Han now marks up the hanging surveyor's map. THE CAMERA IS FRAMING HIM so we can't see what he's working on. Trish sits opposite watching. A long beat before he finishes... (flatly) There is no war between black and Chinese. It's a smoke screen. SLOWLY NOW THE CAMERA CHEATS AROUND TO SHOW... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FULL VIEW
dialogues.text: Where the Waterfront District now has ink circles cluttering the properties Han knows to have changed hands... HAN (cont'd) Your father, mine... They've both been doing the same thing.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (confused) Take it slow here, okay? Doing 2

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: Grabbing up these properties -- as many as they can get their hands on.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: But why the Waterfront? Land values have been dropping there since I was a kid. Most of it's already crackhead country...

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: Don't know yet. But both sides have been killing their own for Tee {an ugly realization washes over him) My brother was dead the moment he found out about it. No matter what he did.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: And Colin?

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: Po must have called to see what Colin knew -- what they could do together to stop it.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: But what would they want the land for? It still doesn't make any sense. But Han is no longer listening. His policeman's eyes distracted by several other maps hanging overhead as well. He slowly pulls down the closest, revealing... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: AN OPAQUE ACETATE
dialogues.text: Stenciled in with a bird's eye graphic of the new football stadium. The flat has been designed to perfectly overlay the Waterfront grid -- illustrating where the stadi a t. i1t. Off their reactions WE MATCH DISSOLVE TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where th ree-di ional_architectura del sits in exactly the same position -- bringing the acetate vividly to life... Ivan and Ch'u sit nearby, the pleasantries long-since abandoned as Ivan's Attorney goes through the Chinese h of the grant deeds.

dialogues.speaker: ATTORNEY
dialogues.text: (wrapping up) Everything's Kosher. Down to the last pagoda. WE NOTICE Kai shoot White Bread a scorching look..

dialogues.speaker: ROTH
dialogues.text: You're a good man, Ch'u Sung. He motions for a_small_ briefcase to be brought over and placed before the Overlord. ROTH (cont'd) Spend it well. Ch'u springs the clasps and opens it LID TOWARDS US so we can't see the contents Instead judging their value by his look of complete satisfaction.

dialogues.speaker: CH'U
dialogues.text: Iwill, Ivan. I always have. (rising to go) I don't expect we'il encounter each other again, so let this serve as farewell. It's been a pleasure. He motions Kai to take the case...

dialogues.speaker: ROTH
dialogues.text: (smiling) You never know. Maybe I'll see you at a ballgame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Han is reviewing Trish's photocopied deed more closely. THE CAMERA FINDS the property recipient listed as "ROTH EQUITY NGS"...

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: All the properties are being turned over to a single company -- Roth Equity Holdings. It may be just a shell, maybe not... He folds the document and gives it to her. HAN (cont'd) Take this and the list to the police. Explain what's happening, tell them everything.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: What about you?

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: I'm going to talk to the new owners. MAC (o.s.) Wrong, Dim Sum. Your ass is staying right here. Han whirls to find...

dialogues.speaker: MAC, MAURICE AND THE DOGS
dialogues.text: Filtering out of the shadows. The dogs hold twelve-quage shotguns at the hip, ready for the slightest excuse to cut Han in half. Maurice is a mess from his tangles with Han -- capped teeth glinting dully, arm splinted, one eye purpled and swollen. But he’s smiling plenty now they've finally captured the Chinese.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Don't take it so hard, brother. The Little Princess here's gonna be fine. Mac takes hold of Trish and pulls her close. Thena really nice moment as he furrows his nose into her hair... MAC (cont'd) Whatta ya say, baby? Catch another romantic dinner, maybe a few stiff drinks to put us in the mood? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ee

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Han motions to the stadium overlay...

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: It's hard to build anything on a mountain of bodies. People will find out, they'll stop you.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: You think any of these lives have really mattered? Your brother's? Colin's? They don't. They never did. In this world there's only the rich, -- everyone else is just an inconvenience. (to Maurice) End this monkey, Mo. And please, take your time doin' it...

dialogues.speaker: HAN AND TRISH
dialogues.text: Share a final, desperate glance from across the room. Her brave face fractured with panic as Ma¢ hustles her out... It's the last thing Han sees before his temple is BUTTED with the heel of a shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Isaak arrives in his Town Car. Just as the valet is taking his keys Ch'u_ steps outside. A strange beat as the rivals find themselves abruptly face to face. Then the biggest shocker of all -- ye i the land scheme together since the very beginning

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: (sees the briefcase) I see you've already finished with Ivan.

dialogues.speaker: CH'U
dialogues.text: Yes -- youx share is waiting inside. Rest assured, the deal was everything he promised.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: Did you ever doubt him?

dialogues.speaker: CH'U
dialogues.text: {slight smile) Not really. (pauses) It worked well, didn't it, our little "war"? I was surprised how many of my people wanted to (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CH'U (cont'd) believe it was real. How many always will.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: It was lucrative, if that's what you mean. (then, colder) Except for an unexpected casualty...

dialogues.speaker: CH'U
dialogues.text: Two unexpected casualities.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: Only one concerns me. (rolls reversed from the airport) I had nothing to do with it.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: Believe me, Ch'u, it won't take much to find out. (reigns it in) But that's a personal matter, best left to personal time. Our business tonight is something else entirely. They share a hard look as the Chinese Overlord's car arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Han regains consciousness in the midst of THE WORST STOMPING OF HIS LIFE. Maurice and his dogs have him chained to a support column and...

dialogues.speaker: A MAGNIFICENT BEATING
dialogues.text: Takes place as the they work him over. This is an unpleasant sequence, sadistic and methodical, and should resonate with the emotional anguish of Toshiro Mifune's dismantling in Yojimbo. It should play for less than a minute, yet feel like days and days...

dialogues.speaker: MAURICE
dialogues.text: (stopping them at last) Alright, alright, already...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sagging back against the column. His scalp and gums are bloodied, and outwardly he seems a ruined husk of a man.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: MAURICE (cont'd) 2 like to be able to at least ize a motherfucker when I'm beeatiae him up. They catch their breath. One shaking the sting of so many punches from his hand.

dialogues.speaker: DOG
dialogues.text: Let's just do him, Mo.

dialogues.speaker: DOG
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm burn-out on this shit. Maurice shrugs and digs out a weapon. Leans down to grab a handful of Han's hair.

dialogues.speaker: MAURICE
dialogues.text: Hear that, Dim Sum? Time go nighty, night. : (then, curious) One thing I gotta know, bro -- you didn't really think you was gonna get them drawers?

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: (raspy, spitting out blood) What?

dialogues.speaker: MAURICE
dialogues.text: That ass, bro. Trish. You really think she was gonna give it up to YOu? His posse chimes in with ADDITIONAL SMACK ("Damn dawg" "Aw, shit" etc.). Han doesn't respond, MAURICE (cont'd) Didn't think so. Best you didn't even try -- after Isaak turns over the deeds at the Top 0O' The Fives, Mac's giving himself a big promotion. (off Han's reaction) Hell, yeah. Gonna dump O'Day into the Bay and take Number One Daughter and all that cash for himself and his dogs... Again Han fails to reply, his eyes flickering like that of a beaten fighter.

dialogues.speaker: MAURICE
dialogues.text: All right, fellas, let's do this. Young Romeo here's gotta die. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CREW
dialogues.text: Whoa, Mo. You can't shoot him here.

dialogues.speaker: MAURICE
dialogues.text: And exactly why not?

dialogues.speaker: CREW
dialogues.text: Mac’1l flip if we stain the carpets. This is gonna be his office now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, dawg. You right. (half beat) Let's throw him out the window.

dialogues.speaker: CREW
dialogues.text: What about the glass?

dialogues.speaker: MAURICE
dialogues.text: (Lightbulb comes on) We'll open it first... And they do. Then they grab Han's limbs like four pall bearers and get a running start -- 1 the 1 e win

dialogues.speaker: SLOW MOTION
dialogues.text: His body being pitched into open space. His left hand SUDDENLY ROCKETS OUT to grab the sill... his right Maurice's tie... He hangs there but a millisecond. Maurice fighting to brace himself against the inside...

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: You ain't the only one knows some shit. And with a YANK they both go spiraling out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where WE WATCH as Han and Maurice plummet for the Pavement. The Chinese now pulls A SPECTACULAR MOVE -- spinning Mo underneath him in mid-air to use him as a human_air bag

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next stop, ground floor. 4 ice' . It leaves him GROANING LIMPLY, as flat as a pancake... (CONTINUED)
150A CONTINUED: i50A 151 152 Han gets up and dusts himself off. Escapes with the others still watching spellbound from above...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Isaak stands outside the entrance as Mac and his bad-asses arrive. Strain is now apparent on the crimeboss' face for the first time. He's allowed himself to envision a new life for he and Trish -- and the price of it is an inevitable vulnerability. Mac is loving every minute of it. Silently pleased at the prospect of his boss having slipped from his game face.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: Trish should already be here by now. (checking watch) Mac -- are you positive they've picked her up?

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Isaak, man, you gotta relax. I talked to Mo and the boys not ten minutes ago. She's safe and she's on the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Isaak and Mac enter. They see Ivan with his attorney and join them at the table...

dialogues.speaker: ROTH
dialogues.text: Isaak, my new friend. At last we conclude our business. (shaking hands) My deeds? Mac passes a small valise across to him. Roth hands it straight-away to his attorney.

dialogues.speaker: ROTH
dialogues.text: No offense, but I'd like David here to review them. He's particularly good with details.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: (shrugs) None taken. They're all there. The attorney quickly thumbs the forms inside. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ran w Nn

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: How was Ch'u Sung tonight? In good spirits, I hope?

dialogues.speaker: ROTH
dialogues.text: Excellent spirits. I expect very shortly you'll be in the same.

dialogues.speaker: ATTORNEY
dialogues.text: (finished) Perfect. Everything's in order.

dialogues.speaker: ROTH
dialogues.text: How wonderful. He motions for a_small briefcase to be brought for Isaak -- it's identical to that given the Chinese earlier.

dialogues.speaker: ROTH
dialogues.text: And this belongs to you. Per our agreement, I think you'll be very pleased.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: (spins it on him) Do I need to have Gummy here review it?

dialogues.speaker: VIEW OF
dialogues.text: One of the baddies -- baby dreads, wired eyes, jaws maniacally pumping his chewing gum back and forth. The absolute antithesis of Ivan's Ivy-League asshole.

dialogues.speaker: ROTH
dialogues.text: (touché) No. It's all there. Isaak draws the case to him anyway. A beat. Then he shocks everyone by pushing it back unopened.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: Keep your cheddar, Ivan. I'd rather you invest it for me. Nobody knows what to make of this -- Ivan and his Attorney slack-jawed, Mac fit to have a major coronary...

dialogues.speaker: ROTH
dialogues.text: Isaak, I'm afraid I don't understand...

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: It's easy. I'm going to be your partner. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ROTH
dialogues.text: My...

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: Sure. High-time the NFL had a black owner, don't think? (lets it sink in) I'm up to the task -- trust me. Used to play a little bail myself. And I do look fantastic inside a luxury-box.

dialogues.speaker: ROTH
dialogues.text: (regains his composure) I'm afraid I already have partners, several in fact. Isaak turns intimidating. The kind of power which underscores his ascension from the wasteland of an Oakland ghetto.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: So add another one. The bid's already been accepted. Without my deeds you're a short hair from ending up in a meat locker yourself. Long beat. Ivan fully realizing the bad spot he's in. Then Mac can't take anymore...

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Fuck the luxury box -- I'll take the green. Isaak finds a fire-breathing Sig-Sauer angled smack at his belly. Mac scoops up the briefcase, intoxicated by the lure of all that cash...

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: a 2 ing?

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: I believe they call it corporate restructurin'. As of right now, O'Day Enterprises is being swallowed whole by Mac, Inc. I'm taking your capital reserves... (holds up the case) And your most valued asset... He signals his dogs and Trish is escorted inside. MAC (cont'd) And then I'm gonna leverage you out. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Isaak makes a vicious lunge for him, fearless in his rage at betrayal...

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: You shitt ttl loodsu ee carried your ass off the streets...

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure -- but what have you done for me lately? Mac GUT-SHOOTS his.mentor, crumpling him to the floor. His daughter rushes to his side.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Mac could care less, HURRIEDLY SPRINGING THE CLASPS to get to the good part...

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Now let's see some shit. There's nothing inside but a white envelope. He snatches 26 Up and rips J Open...

dialogues.speaker: A FIFTY MILLION DOLLAR CORPORATE CHECK
dialogues.text: Made out to "Q'DAY ENTERPRISES" confronts him. Mac about craps himself...

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: A check? A MOTHERFUCKIN' CHECK? I don't believe this... Isaak's WOUNDED LAUGH mocks him from the floor.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAK
dialogues.text: Punk. Now look at your street ass. Nobody's dealing in cash these days.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: (livid) Better hope you stay alive long enough to bank this motherfucker... TO BE WRITTEN: Han BURSTS IN and A FANTASTIC SHOOT-OUT FOLLOWS between Roth's Bodyguards and the blacks. In all the commotion, Roth runs to the roof where a helicopter awaits. But Mac BLOWS HIM AWAY before he can escape... Han takes out the remaining soldiers and then faces off with Mac... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: Two-man game now, Mac. The young lieutenant leans back to rake his barrel across the nape of Trish's neck...

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: You forgettin' about the broad, Ahkbar. Baby makes three.

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: (dispassionate) I want to know why you murdered my brother.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Wasn't me. I killed Colin alright, Isaak didn't know a thing about it. Couldn't risk him killin’ the deal.

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: (insistent) What about Po?

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: You got your own people to thank there. All that shit was handled in-house. Han feels his blood roiling, the depth of what this means almost unfathomable. MAC (cont'd) Now get on your knees or I'll smoke her.

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: Behind you.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: If that ain't some tired bullshit... But Han’s gaze convinces the thug he's for real. Mac turns slowly to find...

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Like you said, Mac -- I'm getting all misty eyed... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She FIRES to put him down... TRISH (cont'd) ... Wishing there were two of you. The SECOND ROUND finishes him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Han and Trish kneel to check Isaak's wound. It's real bad, but he's hanging in. WE HOLD FOR A MOMENT on the ex-gangster, his eyes now silently doing what his seized throat cannot -- thanking Han for saving his daughter and himself. Han covers him with his jacket. Gently places a finger to Trish's lips before leaving...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Han covers the glass pane over the door's deadbolt and SOUNDLESSLY KNOCKS IT OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lavish second floor housing bright Asian flora. Below them, a pool of exotic fish consumes the entire ground level. Han enters the lush greenery. For a moment we're taken aback, feeling as if we've awoken in the humid heart of an Asian jungle. Han wanders in...

dialogues.speaker: KAI
dialogues.text: It was strangely exhilarating, killing Po. Really gave me a rush. HAN ; Why doesn’t that surprise me?

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: (with distaste) : Your brother wasn't suited to lead, Han Sung. He didn't have the stomach for it, the necessary balls.

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: You believed yourself a much better choice. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KAI
dialogues.text: Naturally. (then) Why don't we settle this properly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As again they take stances opposite each other -- their former kinship replaced by an unbridled and unabashed hatred. This is the most scintillating moment in the entire movie. A MARTIAL ARTS BATTLE ROYAL beginning only two men of this caliber could create. There is a vicious grace to the combat, their contrasting styles well-suited. Kai the younger and more aggressive, Han more patient and precise... Han launches A HURRICANE OF KICKS, forcing his enemy back. Kai responds with A COMBINATION OF PUNCHES, hunting and pecking away to the body. Then Han raises the ante. Grabbing Kai's neck and unleashing A SERIES OF HEAD-TO-KNEES -- face forced down, knee savagely coming up to tenderize it. Kai SPINS FREE and SLAMS KICKS to Han's groin and solar plexus, sucking the air out him. And so the war rages...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ultimately coming to a stand-still. Both hurt and hemorrhaging from nose and mouth, each man now proven the other's equal

dialogues.speaker: KAI
dialogues.text: The old man was afraid you might win, Han Sung.

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: And you?

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: I knew you wouldn't. The FIGHT CONTINUES (DETAILS BEING DISCUSSED) as Kai appears to take the upper hand. Han then eee himself to permanently extinguish his brother's killer. (ED_NOTE: We need to find a great way to pay off Kai's here which we've well established earlier in the film.) INT. CH'U SUNG'S MANSION - STUDY - NIGHT eS) Where Ch'u works at his desk, planning for the even brighter future his fat take will afford him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Then his youngest son Han Sung walks through the door.

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: (MANDARIN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it like, Father? He brings Kai's weapon up and trains it on the old man's heart. HAN (cont'd) (MANDARIN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To go on living with your own son's death? Can you sleep? Can you even eat without his face finding you?

dialogues.speaker: CH'U
dialogues.text: Outwardly, Po was always the stronger of you. But inside he was always weak. Weak and sickly with compassion for strangers, outsiders. He put his own interests -- their interests -- above those of the family.

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: (MANDARIN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What family? There is only you and your money. When has it ever been any different? (bitter laugh) The Mainland? Hong Kong?

dialogues.speaker: CH'U
dialogues.text: What he knew would have ruined things with Roth, would have i us. I did everything I could to scare him off...

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: Except the right thing. Except what you knew was right. (torn apart) To take his side and be his father. Han stands teetering with an unendurable amount of rage. Never has he wanted to kill with the hunger he does right now.

dialogues.speaker: CH'U
dialogues.text: (unaffected) What do you assume to do with me? Have your vengeance? Will that bring him back, Han? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: No. I have honored my brother properly -- I found those responsible for his death. (slowly) The rest is for others, strangers. Han RACKS A SINGLE ROUND into the chamber and SLIDES the weapon's full clip into his pocket. q 1 A in _butt-fi L

dialogues.speaker: . HAN
dialogues.text: If the police don't get you, the other Chinese families will. He slides it across. Giving the old man just one bullet to do his bidding. One bullet for either himself or his son... HAN (cont'd) Do what you will, Ch'u. But this time no one will go to prison for you. It serves as their final good-bye. Han slowly turns and 1 ove: wi Completely exposing himself to the mercy of his murderous father. Ch'u picks up the weapon... levels it Han's back...

dialogues.speaker: LOOKING OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: Where DISTANT SIRENS momentarily precede A PACK OF COP CARS FISH-TAILING onto the street and SPEEDING for the long stone driveway... But still Han doesn‘t turn. Giving his father the cleanest of shots at a motionless target. Ch'u clinches the weapon with TREMBLING hands, finger coiling around the trigger... BLAAMM! THE GUN FIRES. Its WHITE FLASH BLINDING THE ROOM as WE HARD CUT TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where THE ARMADA OF BLACK-AND-WHITES are now SCREAMING up to the front, STROBING the yard with harsh red and blue rack-lights... emerges from the back of a patrol car -- A MATRIX- STYLE SLOW-MOTION FIGURE centered in A FAST-MOTION FLURRY OF ARMED COPS... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Her eyes are lost in silent prayer as they strafe the house. A punishing beat. Then...

dialogues.speaker: HAN
dialogues.text: es from inside in MATRIX-SsT' -MOTION as well. The Chinese resembles a human train wreck at this point, completely trashed by his long odyssey. But he alone stands as sole survivor. The couple cuts a path through the circus of law enforcement, STAYING IN SLOW-MOTION, focused only on each other...

dialogues.speaker: HAN AND TRISH
dialogues.text: Where he scans her face before they touch -- the gentle lilt tells him Isaak is going to be alright. Then they come together in a long dreamed-of embrace... Trish softly pulls free. Leans in to kiss him. You know, it is a great country. He just might stay. THE CAMERA PULLS BACK as Trish holds tightly to Han's hand, the couple centered within the chaos. THEN BACK FURTHER STILL AS WE...
